Title: Test Automation Engineer
Description:
With the rapid growth of artificial intelligence, expert knowledge must use cutting-edge machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems. At Matroid, we're building an intuitive product that allows anyone to train and deploy computer vision models without the need to write code.
Founded by a Stanford Professor in 2016, Matroid has raised $33.5 million in funding and is in use in a range of manufacturing, security, and industrial IoT applications.
We're looking for a talented test automation engineer to build out a testing framework for our computer vision services. You'll operate with autonomy while working in an engineering culture that fosters empowerment. Along the way you will learn about cutting edge machine learning, and over time your role on the team will evolve with your growing interests and skill set.
Once we reopen, this position will be onsite at our Palo Alto office, near the Stanford campus and Caltrain.
What you'll be doing
Develop automated tests for our product and services using frameworks like Mocha, Selenium, Jest
Work with our development team to test new features, converting initial manual efforts into new automated tests
Identify new automation best practices for our growing engineering team
Improve our continuous delivery pipeline, ensuring that we can roll out frequent, robust releases
Raise the bar for our product quality, by catching bugs before they get to end users
Design methods to test complex machine learning pipelines
How you'll be doing it
You'll be part of a world-class, multidisciplinary engineering team, where each member identifies and prioritizes valuable and interesting new features to work on.
You will operate in a collaborative but highly autonomous environment that isn't bogged down by unnecessary meetings or project management.
You will know that almost everything you build affects real world users, and you will set the quality standards for your work appropriately.
You will think creatively and your suggestions about new features and ideas we'll be considered by other members of the team.
You'll be working with modern Javascript and Python testing frameworks and infrastructure.
You will learn a lot along the way, diving into new technologies and the world of computer vision both on your own and during frequent company tech talks.
What you'll bring to the table
You have experience testing large scale software products.
You are a self starter who can prioritize what to work on and build out a robust testing pipeline.
You have the creativity to always think of new ways to break things. You won't settle until until we've covered as many corner cases as possible.
You're comfortable writing a variety of tests: during a given week you might go from writing unit tests for a backend service to end-to-end functional browser tests.
You can show that you're smart, analytical, and a fast learner. Sometimes you'll work on things using unfamiliar languages or technologies, but you know you can handle that.
There aren't any strict requirements for your background, but you're technical. Maybe you have a CS (or similar) degree, or you're a bootcamp grad with a STEM background, or you might be self taught with a few years of industry experience.
What we offer in return
Competitive pay and equity
The chance to constantly work on stimulating intellectual challenges.
Gym membership reimbursement
Free, lunch, snacks, and caffeine every day
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
A flexible schedule that leaves time for all of your other interests
A budget for whatever hardware will make you most effective
Budget and resources to learn about the cutting edge of software engineering and computer vision
Job Position id: With the rapid growth of artificial intelligence, expert knowledge must use cutting-edge machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems. At Matroid, we're building an intuitive product that allows anyone to train and deploy computer vision models without the need to write code.

Title: QA Functional Tester
Description:
TITLE: QA Functional Tester - Experience testing complex enterprise software solutions
LOCATION: Remote until further notice
PAY: Target pay for this role is between $55 and $65 per hour but may vary based on experience.

OVERVIEW:
ProFocus is searching for a QA Functional Tester with experience testing complex enterprise software solutions for a 6–12 month contract.
This is a Senior level QA Functional Tester role with great pay and is responsible for functional and performance testing of both custom developed applications as well as 3rd party applications like Guidewire’s ClaimCenter. Must be able to troubleshoot found issues to ensure defects are valid and help get closer to a possible cause. Please email us your resume so we can discuss.

POSITION DETAILS
Work closely with business analysts and developers to identify, script, and execute functional test cases
Create automated functional test cases
Identify regression test cases
Document and track issues identified in testing
Analyze failed test execution for failure point/s, and document all findings
Audit unit test results
Create automated functional test cases that can be executed by the extended testing team
Create and execute performance test scripts and report on the results

REQUIREMENTS
5 years of experience in quality assurance testing
Minimum of 3 years in functional testing experience required
1+ year experience testing APIs using Postman or Swagger API Development/Testing platforms
Have proven experience with automated testing tools such as Micro Focus UFT, LoadRunner, Selenium, Jmeter etc.
Must be team oriented, enjoy working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, and have communication skills
Authorization to work in the US is a precondition of employment. We do not sponsor work visas.

PREFERRED
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or demonstrate equivalent experience
Experience with Behavior Testing Framework
Experience working in an enterprise/cross functional organization
Previous work experience claims systems or Guidewire InsuranceSuite

ABOUT OUR CLIENT
Our client is a mid-sized company with a passion for helping their customers, great work environment, reputation, and culture.

WHY ProFocus
Candidates come first. ProFocus recently earned the Best in Staffing Award for Talent Satisfaction due to our World-Class service to our amazing candidates.
Quality process. We invest the time to learn about your skills, experience, and career goals in detail so we can find you a position that is a great fit.
Access to hiring managers. We have close relationships with some of the most respected companies in Portland. Due to those relationships, we can provide direct access to managers and positions that may not be available anywhere else.
Excellent benefits. We offer medical, dental, vision, 401k, education reimbursement, sick leave, and employer-paid short-term disability and life insurance.

Want to learn more? Contact one of our recruiters here or email info@ProFocusTechnology.com.
Please email us your resume to apply: Resume@ProFocusTechnology.com
Visit our Job Seekers page to learn more and review other opportunities.

ProFocus is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in our workplace and encourage all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Title: QA Specialist - Core Back Office
Description:
The QA Specialist is responsible for ensuring the timely delivery of a high-quality product that exceeds the expectations of Inside Real Estate customers and partners. Success in this role is measured by the QA Specialists’ ability to collaborate with product team members to define comprehensive and creative test plans that validate the product meets the requirements in terms of customer use cases, correctness, reliability, stability, usability, performance, privacy, and security.

Responsibilities
Work collaboratively with Product Owners on feature documentation, comprehensive test plans and on critical issues as they arise in production.
Define regression tests for product REST endpoints and web user interface.
Collaborate with QA automation engineers to define and implement tools that improve the efficiency of manual testing.
Collaborate with program managers, developers, and other quality assurance engineers to define and execute test plans for new features.
Assist in creating a Confluence library to track/update all current and changing functionality.
Identify reliability, stability, performance, accessibility, security and privacy issues in the product and report these in the team’s Jira bug tracking system.
Requirements
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field or experience in software quality assurance, software testing and/or senior software support role
Highly methodical test discipline in functional and visual testing
Able to work independently and be flexible with changing priorities
Strong analytical skills, detailed, and process-oriented; ability to clearly define detailed test cases, and document corner cases
Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with web user interfaces and web services
Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Slack, Github, Bitbucket, Envoyer, Postman, TestRails and Zoom
Experience with Smoke testing, Functional Testing, Integration Testing, Regression testing and API testing on staging and production server environments


Bonus Qualifications (experience with any of the following is a bonus)
Developing automated tests and especially automating the testing of web services and web user interfaces.
Experience with billing, commission tracking and disbursements, along with reporting and accounting. Especially related to the real estate industry.
Benefits
Potential for growth
Exciting/energetic work environment and fun, creative culture
Health insurance, Dental and 401k matching
Paid Holidays and Paid Time Off
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer for Fortune 500 Company
Description:
About Us:
Ready Artwork is a fast-paced and fast growing full service digital marketing agency located in Monrovia, California. Ready Artwork specializes in designing and marketing websites for private and public brands. We grow clients’ online presence through custom website designs, E-commerce websites, Search Engine Optimization (SEO), internet marketing, Social Media Marketing (SMM) and much more. Our culture is to be humble, have fun, and give a damn. If you are seeking a career path in a fun and exciting environment that focuses on teamwork, support, and growth, join us!
Job Description
Looking for a web-focused Quality Engineer with automated tool development experience and familiarity with the website development process to help ensure website quality through thorough manual and automated testing for a 6-month Contract to work directly with our client, Adobe.
This QE would be responsible for reviewing AEM site code and functionality to ensure acceptance criteria are met, web best practices are followed, and the site is bug free on a daily basis. This role would involve managing and maintaining a set of manual and self-automated test cases in primarily Javascript using WebDriverIO for automated browser testing.
Responsibilities
Automate feature tests for web pages according to test specification
Meet mandated deadlines
Provide status to team regularly
Effectively raise issues to management
Requirements
Undergraduate degree in computer science, and have 1 – 2 years working experience in web development
Self-driven, and working with team members to identify and solve challenging problems
Expertise with specific web technologies, including Adobe AEM, JavaScript, CSS, React, Bootstrap, and cache management
Familiarity with web test automation tools such as Selenium, Appium, WebdriverIO, Cucumber, and Mocha
Experienced with common tools such as GitHub, CircleCI/Jenkins, Rundeck, Mongo DB

Title: SDET Engineer
Description:
Beta Breakers is one of the leading resources for software quality assurance services in the world. Our offices are located in Novato, California. Beta Breakers' clients range from small 4-5 person companies all the way to Fortune 500 firms. We are currently looking to augment our testing team with software test automation engineers who prefer to work in an interesting and fast-paced environment.
As an SDET at Beta Breakers, you will be involved in a test automation effort using Selenium driven by C#. Our current need is for a contract that will last 6+ months, but if you perform well, we will almost certainly ask you to join us permanently once the contract is concluded.

Title: Automated Tester / Remote
Description:
Description:
CyOne, Inc. is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented Tester to join our team in support of our Intelligence and Targeting platforms. The ideal candidate is passionate about delivering high-quality products, performs well in a team environment, learns quickly, and desires to continuously develop their skills. The candidate will participate in the design, development, enhancement of test scripts and manual testing efforts for CyOne’s platforms. Become an integral part of a diverse and cutting-edge team, where our employees come first.

US Citizenship is required, and a DoD Secret clearance is desired (Top Secret/SCI preferred).

The automated tester will be expected to:
Design test plans, procedures, scenarios, and scripts to accurately assess new products or software updates
Perform integration, regression, performance, and formal qualification tests.
Identify, analyze, and create detailed records of problems that appear during testing, such as software defects, bugs, functionality issues, and output errors, and work directly with software developers to find solutions and develop re-testing procedures.
Track problems, resolutions, and bug fixes throughout testing and create a comprehensive database of defects and successful mitigation techniques.
Communicate clearly and effectively with users, developers, and leads to facilitate quick resolution of problems and accurate documentation of successes.
Design and implement automated testing tools when possible, and update tools as needed to ensure currency and accuracy
Design and execute scripts for automated testing tools when possible, and update the scripts as needed to adapt to front and backend changes to verify continuity of functionality
Develop plans and reports for performance testing to determine usability and scalability of the system under normal and stress scenarios
About CyOne, Inc.
CyOne is composed of a team of highly experienced, trained, and motivated cyber security specialists, software development engineers, intelligence analysts, and technological consultants. The knowledge and experience of our teams spans across multiple intelligence and engineering domains within DOD.
Our team’s in-depth understanding of customer requirements allows our expert systems engineers and software developers to successfully transform requirements and software prototypes into mature capability sets and solutions that are consistently well-received and adopted solutions by our customers.
By being at the “tip of the spear” our team can help assess our customer’s applicable needs and assist with defining their processes. This enables our team of experts to successfully forecast, design, and engineer future capability requirements to support global DoD operations among our customer bases.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
Competitive Compensation
Comprehensive Benefits Package!
The chance to join a fast-growing software company helping customers with bleeding edge technology
. Requirements:
Minimum of five (5) years’ experience in software engineering/development and/or systems engineering/analysis.
At least three (3) years demonstrated experience with a major JavaScript testing framework.
Trained and Experience in software testing, concepts, practices and procedures of software development, and quality assurance.
Experience with automated testing tools such as TestComplete, Cross Browser, Selenium/Cypress, or JMeter
A bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics, or related discipline may be substituted for three (3) years of work experience.

The candidate will participate in the design, development, enhancement of test scripts and manual testing efforts for CyOne’s platforms. Become an integral part of a diverse and cutting-edge team, where our employees come first.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Riiid Labs - https://www.riiidlabs.com/home
Machine Learning Engineer
San Ramon, CA
Riiid Labs is a leading solutions provider of fully data-driven AI technology. We partner with global leaders in education and technology to create better learning experiences. Our vision is for our AI to power personalized learning for everyone in the world. Riiid has recently received $175M in funding from Softbank's Vision Fund 2, with over $250M in total funding to date.
The Role
We’re in search of a Machine Learning Engineer who’s ready to help us improve our customer experience by building performant systems that bring our business to new heights. You’ll need to have strong experience in hybrid clouds, because you’ll be enhancing on-premises GPU environments in addition to developing Terraform templates for AWS services to support custom applications. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll also be working in conjunction with like-minded departments such as AI Research and Digital Engineering to deploy these new products and manage our infrastructure, associated processes and systems. It’ll definitely help for you to be a skilled problem solver and consensus-builder, because you’ll also be helping us to streamline our processes—and automating them where applicable.
Responsibilities:
Construct an advanced Machine Learning infrastructure through collaboration with the AI Research, Engineering, and Product teams.
Develop a culture of best practices in transforming machine learning code into operant and performant IaaS, SaaS, and AIaaS.
Build and apply geo-specific deployment environments using Kubernetes (Docker).
Various methods are compared and analyzed through active PoC (Proof of Concept) to find the optimal solution and apply it to the service.
Design and build an automated system for hypothesis generation and testbeds that can operate various services and handle user traffic.
Build a Kubernetes cluster to allow developers to create and update infrastructure components at any time, allowing easy service expansion.
Build a robust monitoring system to easily check the status of services and detect system anomalies immediately.
Anticipate and respond to system anomalies in advance.
Immediately identify and act through the log infrastructure and analytics system.
Looking for:
M.S. or Ph.D. in Computer Science or a related form of Data Engineer training.
2+ years of experience deploying machine learning algorithms into customer-facing Production systems.
Experience with coding for automated, process-driven dataflows to increase the efficiency of ML algorithms and resources.
Experience with NLP, vision processing, deep neural networks, across text, imaging.
Experience with creating software to automate production systems with most of the following languages: Python, Java, TensorFlow, Databricks, JavaScript, C/C++.
Experience with Amazon Web Services, Azure and/or GCP.
Experience with infrastructure as code platform Terraform.
Experience with container technologies and orchestration (Kubernetes).
Experience with GPU cluster management, enhancement, and minimizing underutilized resources.
Experience with developing with gRPC (Protocol Buffers).
Experience with with source control, Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development methods (Git, Selenium, Jenkins).
Experience with strong knowledge of Linux systems and internals.
Candidate must have demonstrated experience in troubleshooting problems and working with a team to resolve web-scale production issues.
Building scalable Machine Learning pipelines using Kubeflow, MLFlow, Airflow.
Strong Python Coding Skills.
Object Oriented Programming Skills.
End to End ML experience : Preprocessing, Training, and serving different ML models.
Familiarity with Scikit Learn, Numpy, Pandas, Pytorch, Tensorflow, KerasSDLC (Software Development Lifecycle) and Microservice Unit test framework Pytest.
Collaborating with AI Scientists to understand the crux of Model Development and serve it in a production environment.

Health insurance
Health savings account
Paid time off

Title: Functional Tester
Description:
Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A operations professional who wants to work in a collaborative environment. As an experienced Functional Tester you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. If so, consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model that is tailored specifically for long-term, onsite client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing extensive travel, and provides you with a full career path within the firm.
Work you'll do
Deloitte is a key partner with the 2nd largest cable company in the US and is actively expanding its presence in the Technology Services division. As part of this expansion we are seeking to hire a Functional Tester.
The Team
The US Core Technology Operations Offering delivers large scale software applications and integrated systems and assists its clients with architecture design, assessment and optimization, and definition. The practice aims at developing service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integration solutions to enable information sharing and management between business partners and disparate processes and systems. It would focus on key client issues that impact the core business by delivering operational value, driving down the cost of quality, and enhancing technology innovation.
Qualifications
Required

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience
Support system testing/integration/deployment activities
Develop test cases, from functional requirements to clearly convey the business user's intent.
Participate in triage process, fully reproducing production issues, communicating workarounds, developing missing test scenarios, and validating fixes; accurately submitting and maintaining defects in the appropriate repository.
Perform manual exploratory and acceptance testing of new features being iteratively developed as part of agile development methodology.
Attend system design reviews; technical interchange meetings; any other meetings as requested to support program and team
Troubleshoot logs & JSON messages as part of integration testing
Strong understanding in Java, JS, Selenium Web Driver, Appium
Ability to use ALM, JIRA for test case & execution management
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Be a team player working with a diverse group of team members
Must be willing to live in or relocate to Denver, CO.
Limited immigration sponsorship may be available
Preferred

Title: QA Test Manager
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
FortifID Inc. is transforming the way personal information is shared between consumers and businesses that provide services and monetize data gathered from their consumers. Our vision is to create a world where personal information is shared, verified and monetized in a secure, consent-driven manner. By creating a zero raw data emissions digital eco system, FortifID Inc. enables consumers and businesses to share insights, instead of specific personal identifiable information (PII), which allows for the use of services and the verification and monetization of data while protecting consumer personal data rights.
FortifID is looking for a Software Engineer in Test, who is motivated to bring the highest quality software to our customers. Responsibilities include manual testing and creating automation test cases to test FortifID solutions, including APIs and web interfaces.
We want someone who can envision what our testing program will be and how that fits into our tech stack, lay the foundation and build the team to do it. They need to be able to do the testing too. The "plan, build and do". So, the leading/communicating aspect of this role needs to be more experienced. I think this person has to have held a Lead Role for a while and managed a team of 3-4+ engineers.
Responsibilities
You will write automated test scripts to perform test of FortifID use cases and workflows. The test scripts suite shall cover logical branches of uses cases and confirm the results. The automation tests will cover both front-end web UI and backend APIs.
Work with product manager and engineering team to understand the overall use cases and perform some manual testing as well.
Load testing: you will write automated test scripts to do load testing of the system, to measure the behaviors of system under expected load (2x – 3x of normal peak) and confirm desirable system performance.
Stress testing: you will write automated test scripts to do stress testing of the system, try to break the system, to identify the breaking point, in terms of component and resources, such as memory, CPU, disk IO or network.
Executing, tracking and reporting on the automated tests development and execution.
Analyzing the results and publish automation status dashboards.
Qualifications
9+ years of Automation and Manual Testing Experience
Solid software engineering background, understanding of data structure, basic algorithms, operating systems, and system design concepts.
4+ years coding experience in Python
4+ years of coding experience in Java, or JavaScript
Prior experience in web application automation tool such as Selenium.
Prior experience in using automation test framework such as Robot Framework and NoseTest.
API Gateway and API development and test experience, including API lifecycle management.
Familiar with SOAP/WSDL, REST interfaces.
Experience in public cloud development and deployment such as AWS, Azure and GCP is a plus.
Experience in working with banking applications is a plus.
Experience working in financial services, fintech, high growth companies a plus.
An ability to plan, build and do is essential.
Be self-motivated, organized, and possess good communication skills.

Title: Child Support QA
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Insight Global is seeking 9 Automaton QE's for a top client. The location preference is Basking Ridge, NJ (where team sits), Minneapolis (HG) or 100% REMOTE. They will join a team of 13 total QA Testers and 13 Automation Testers. This is part of a portal being built related to Child Welfare and is a 7 year program. They started the QA portion 2 years ago and these team members will be joining the Child Support Track. The Web Portal is being completely modernized. Examples of scenarios include a new case being assigned to a Social Worker where the process begins. The QA Engineers then gather the necessary data/ files related to mother/ father data, financial support, and test the functionality of this data. It requires gathering information from State/ Federal Level, DMV, IRS, etc. Being familiar with these processes will be a huge help.

These candidates will understand and identify risk, issues, for the testing scope, participate as needed in specific testing activities (reviews, walk-thru’s etc), Create test scenarios, test cases (detailed steps and expected behavior) and upload to test management tools (ALM, Rally), and ensure that correct traceability is established for linking test cases with business requirements. They will also identify and setup test data needed to support test case execution, execute test cases and create defects for failed test cases, and document test results. Where needed, they will provide UAT support (explain tested functionality to the UAT testers) as well as participate in defect triage calls and ensure that the defined defect management process is followed, and escalate issues and risks to Test Leads and Managers. They will also assist with finalization of test closure activities such as lesson learnt, defect/execution trends and consolidate, Test execution status and report out progress to Test Leads.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
2+ years of experience as a Automation/ Functional QE- experience writing test cases, execution of cases
Prior working knowledge on Child Support within the last 2 years (NOT Foster Care, Child Care- focused on SUPPORT aspect)
1+ years of experience working with Selenium
Prior State or Federal Industry Experience (Child Support aspect)
Bachelor’s Degree
DESIRED SKILLS
Prior Manual QA Knowledge- ALM and Rally are main tools
Comfortable with Support for Manual Team

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description:
Description
Exago is a 15 year old, privately held, growing and financially stable software company operating in the very hot business intelligence and analytics space. Our culture is built upon openness, integrity and a strong sense of one’s own accountability. Our internal motto is “I’m my own CEO." We have been selected as a Connecticut Tech Top 40 Company by Marcum over the past 4 years and are a highly rated embedded BI vendor on G2Crowd. This is an exciting time to join the Exago team as we expand our client base across every vertical and multiple geographies. If you want to join a company where you can make an immediate impact Exago may be the right place for you.
We believe that a user’s first impression with the application or feature will serve as the foundation for future experiences both positive or negative. By combining our own unique, individual perspective with a deep understanding of an application’s systems and use cases, diverse feedback on engineering processes, product design choices and code change implications can occur. We design, we develop and we review test systems, test strategies and product quality processes to protect the stability of the application from future product changes that could inhibit everyday users from the value we set out to provide.
Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.
Requirements:
Degree in Computer Science or comparable programming knowledge/experience.
2+ years or professional experience in software development.
Working knowledge of a modern code language.
A self-starter with a can do attitude. We need engineers who can overcome technical challenges with creativity and polish. Our mantra is “Be your own CEO.”
Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills.
Bots are programmed to execute a desired set of tasks continuously. Bots are not encouraged to apply. Although there is some level of daily repetition to the role, to list exactly what tasks and/or assignments a Senior Test Automation Engineer at Exago will encounter would be a crime and a contradiction to the "Be your own CEO" culture we promote internally. However, here is some insight in the type of work you will be engaged in.
Areas of Focus
Implementing new testing infrastructure to parts of the application not covered by automated testing.
Authoring new automated test scripts using Selenium C# and other code libraries.
Collaborating with the development team on strategies to improve the testability of the application code base.
Implementing new testing environments and maintaining existing test infrastructure.
Assisting with technical direction and guidance for fellow automation engineers.

Title: QA Test Engineer
Description:
At Greenlight Guru, our innovative software helps companies build medical devices that improve and extend the lives of millions of people. Engineers and Quality professionals use our Software as a Service platform to build quality into their device development process.

We currently have an exciting opportunity for the right individual to be an integral member of our Product Development team. You will be working with an elite team of dedicated, engaged software professionals in a core role that will be pivotal to our success.

We are looking for a Quality Engineer to join our testing team and work closely with our development team and product team to ensure the overall quality of our product.

Responsibilities of the job include:
Create and execute test strategies based on product requirements:

Assess the potential risks associated with the changes

Design and execute manual functional tests

Report bugs

Verify corrected defects

Report on the overall quality of the features

Build and execute automated tests

Design and write automated tests according to feature test strategies

Execute automated tests

Analyze automated test results

Troubleshoot and resolve failures in the automated tests

Participate in Scrum ceremonies as part of an agile development team:

Sprint planning sessions to understand the requirements and scope of the work

Daily standups to provide updates on the progress of work as it pertains to the project

Retrospectives to identify what went well and how we can improve

Great-fit candidates will have:
At least five years of experience in technical roles (software testing preferred) in SaaS software development environments

Experience with automated testing tools

Experience testing APIs, specifically GraphQL

We’ll be extra excited about you if you have:
Experience with Cypress

Experience with Postman

The ability to write complex SQL queries

Experience with performance testing tools

Benefits:
Co-workers who care deeply about our mission to spur medical device innovation and about helping each other become better engineers

Flexible hours

Work from home options

PTO

3 months paid maternity leave

Health insurance

Disability insurance

401k

This is a full-time, permanent position, either fully remote or based in our downtown Indianapolis HQ. We do not offer Visa sponsorship or relocation assistance at this time. No recruiters, please.

Greenlight Guru is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Greenlight Guru are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation.

Title: Sr. SDET
Description:
GoodRx is America’s healthcare marketplace. Each month, 20 million people visit goodrx.com to find reliable health information and discounts for their healthcare — and we’ve helped people save $30 billion since 2011. We provide prescription discounts that are accepted at more than 70,000 pharmacies in the U.S., as well as telehealth services including doctor visits and lab tests. Our services have been positively reviewed by Good Morning America, The New York Times, NBC News, AARP, and many others.

Our goal is to help Americans find convenient and affordable healthcare. We offer solutions for consumers, employers, health plans, and anyone else who shares our desire to provide affordable prescriptions to all Americans.

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has a seat at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunities to excel.

With that said, research shows that women and other underrepresented groups apply only if they meet 100% of the criteria. GoodRx is committed to leveling the playing field, and we encourage women, people of color, those in the LGBTQ+ communities, and Veterans to apply for positions even if they don’t necessarily check every box outlined in the job description. Please still get in touch - we’d love to connect and see if you could be good for the role!

About the Role

The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is responsible for leading our efforts in combining sound development practices, leveraging proven testing techniques and technologies, and collaborating in efforts to deliver solutions where there exists gaps in GoodRx’s mission to deliver high quality products with continuously improving efficiency.

In this role, the SDET will be working with cross-functional teams including Developers, Product Managers, QA Engineers, Designers, and Technical Managers to ensure that the quality of our development and products are released on time with solid test automation coverage. This candidate will be responsible for recommending, improving and implementing testing tools, techniques and technologies. This candidate will drive adoption and distribute ownership of quality across their teams for maximum efficiency. Success looks like everyone in the team contributing meaningfully to a practical part of the quality process. Our team runs millions of automated tests every year, most of which are fully integrated into our deployment pipelines. We are looking for a champion of quality that can work alongside other quality enthusiasts at GoodRx to continuously improve our testing efficiency while maintaining our bar of quality to the levels our customers demand and deserve.
Responsibilities:
Partner with product and engineering teams to review system requirements and technical design documents and ensure new features are developed using automation in mind.
Recommend, augment and implement usage of proven automation tools, technologies and techniques to solve specific situations.
Elevate the quality of our releases by helping maintain automated tests integrated into our CI/CD pipelines.
Distribute ownership of quality across the team and provide delightful tools and support for smooth adoption.
Enable short and direct feedback loops on the quality of every code submission.
Enable developers with the tools (technologies or otherwise) to begin establishing confidence from the very start of feature design and implementation.
A leader and a champion for Quality practices within GoodRx and an advocate for our customers’ expectations.
Staying up to date with process, tools, technologies, techniques and solutions. Leading evaluation discussions in our internal community of Quality practitioners.
Skills & Qualifications:
A minimum of 4+ years of SDET experience (or development experience)
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a related field or equivalent experience in similar field required
4+ years of experience with automation frameworks testing Web Apps, Mobile Apps, and/or API’s using frameworks like Playwright, Puppeteer, Selenium, Appium, Cypress, pyTest.
Hands on experience using version control systems such as Git and a solid understanding of Git workflows
Strong software development skills and a solid understanding of software development practices and methodologies (code structure, unit testing, mocking, algorithms, etc).
Hands on experience with cross browser compatibility testing of web applications, mobile applications
Hands on experience working with continuous integration tools
Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools
Avid Learner: Passion for continuous learning and able to effectively communicate technology-oriented concepts.
Nice to Have:
TypeScript experience
DevOps experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, or Google Cloud Computing Services
Developer by background but knows and likes ensure code works properly
Natural curiosity and need to understand how things work
Open source contributions
GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $30 billion using GoodRx and 20 million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com.

Title: QA Engineer (Remote)
Description:
Primary.Health is the engine behind your COVID-19 testing and vaccination programs. Our web-based
platform provides government agencies, schools, healthcare facilities, and community based
organizations the ability to quickly register participants, schedule appointments, arrange for easy onsite
check-in and check-out, and exchange data between labs and state databases, easing the reporting
process.

JOB TITLE: QA Engineer
JOB TYPE: Full-time
LOCATION: Remote
JOB SCOPE:

As a Quality Engineer at Primary you will be responsible for quality assurance related activities and
following the complete end-to-end testing lifecycle including testing the products existing and new
features, automating test cases, reporting bugs, etc. You will be working closely with our Developers and
Product Managers. We are a fast moving organization, typically do multiple deployments per day, and
are looking for great people to build software to help power this.
MAJOR JOB DUTIES:
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to plan and execute on engineering projects.
Develop automated tests against a comprehensive healthcare platform.
Work closely with the engineering team to figure out how best to deploy software safely

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum of 3+ years of industry experience in QA or a testing environment
Ability to develop test strategy, design test plans and test cases
Experience writing automated tests with selenium, capybara, against complex web services.
You’re fluent in at least one major programming language and would be able to switch between
multiple languages. In our stack, we mainly use Ruby on Rails and React.
You have strong SQL query knowledge
You can break down complex problems rigorously and understand the tradeoffs necessary to
deliver great, impactful products.
You’re curious, you’re data-driven, you love to ask questions, and you think critically about
problems.
You love delivering value to your users and your teammates through your work.

You’ve demonstrated your ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

Primary embraces diversity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer - Personal Savings
Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
We are building a banking platform that enables teams to create products at scale and power digitals channels to deliver compelling experiences in a dramatically faster fashion. From initial requirements to product launch, it's integral to ensure that everything works according to specification. That's why we're looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to help us maintain our world-renowned level of quality and reliability.
By joining our team, you will be assessing software quality by designing and implementing software testing processes. You will take ownership of code quality through exploratory and automated tests. You will hunt bugs, identify issues, report them, and see that they're dealt with. Clicking around is boring and if that is what you are looking for this is not for you, our vision is to collaborate with development and leverage developers as much as possible to avoid the duplication of the clicking task.
We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. We welcome diverse perspectives and people who are not afraid to challenge assumptions.
Our mission is to accelerate the pace of financial innovation and build new financial products for American Express. Our platform streamlines the process of launching and iterating on financial products.
Responsibilities:
Review and analyze requirements, specifications, and technical design documents, providing timely feedback
Develop detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases
Prioritize and plan testing activities
Play the role of test engineer: Design, develop, and execute automated tests
Identify and report issues found, then verify that issues are resolved
Perform regression testing and User acceptance testing.
Experience with performance and accessibility testing are nice to haves
Proven work experience in software quality assurance
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
Keen eye for detail and a commitment to excellence
Be willing to help your teammates, share your knowledge with them, and learn from them
Be open to receiving constructive feedback and turning it into process improvements
Experience triggering testing in the context of CI environments
Experience with WireMock, Jmeter, Selenium, Jenkins are nice to haves
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

Title: Technical Implementation Specialist
Description:
Who You Are:
You are a subject matter expert for all Technical aspects of our Implementation systems, platforms, and processes. This includes project spin-up, CMS configuration, technical integrations with other systems, website deployment (domain management, registrar configuration and management), and redirect management using various G5 tooling and applying industry best practices.
As the Technical Implementation Specialists, you will communicate directly with G5 customers to provide subject matter expertise on technical implementation issues. This communication will be managed by G5 project, account, or support teams as needed.
You will take ownership of technical issues impacting implementation efforts. Technical Implementation specialists diagnose, troubleshoot, and submit tickets for technical issues that arise in the department's day-to-day operation. The TIS team works closely with other implementation teams, including Website Implementation specialists, to understand issues impacting efficiency and G5's ability to accommodate design and functionality requests. TIS team members act as a liaison between Professional Services and G5 Product and Engineering to report, track, and identify mitigation opportunities for these issues.
Your Next Challenge:
Assist in client-based communications with technical knowledge and expertise to alleviate confusion and offer solutions to improve client interactions
Support Implementation projects by building customer websites, as needed
Setup and troubleshoot Pricing & Availability integrations using a SOAP & Rest client such as Boomerang or Postman
Work with Project Managers and Clients to configure website DNS records via the client's domain registrar
High level of knowledge supporting all of G5's verticals, including but not limited to Multifamily, Self-Storage, and Senior Living
Support the Customer Operations and Services department in implementing Enhancement projects
Support the Website Implementation Specialist team & ProServices in setting up and troubleshooting the proprietary services within G5's Platform
Identify areas for improvement on individual applications, or how applications interact with each other
Maintain an understanding and proficiency of the technical aspects of each vertical
Interpret Website & Product downgrades, including but not limited to deactivating services
Submit enhancement and new tooling requests to help improve G5's platform
Report issues that arise with detailed reproduction steps and impact to clients
Scope out and create tooling that helps provide efficiencies to the team using Javascript
Create and maintain documentation for G5s standard platform and service setup, troubleshooting, and best practices for the Website Implementation Specialist team to follow
Be a point-of-contact for Website Registrar and Domain Management issues to assist the Project Management team in error-free launches
Utilizing an in-depth technical skill set and knowledge of the G5 platforms to aid in diagnosing and troubleshooting issues
Escalating issues to the required team or department and tracking them through to resolution
What You'll Need:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Web Design, Management Information System or equivalent experience
2-3 years of experience in the field or in a related area and 1 year of G5 experience
Attention to detail and a desire to satisfy the client. In addition, it is critical that a candidate for this position have a commitment to an extremely high level of quality in their own work and others
The ability to prioritize based on company and departmental directives and the motivation to follow-through and finish projects based on those priorities is a must
Strong organizational and time management skills
General business skills, industry knowledge, long-term vision
Ability to identify, address, and resolve client related issues
Excellent skills in communicating ideas both verbally and in written form in a clear, concise, and professional manner
Ability to communicate effectively with clients and co-workers in an organized, professional manner
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, and clients
Ability to design, document, and implement process improvements

As a Senior Software Quality Engineer, you will join a multi-functional product team and implement test strategies to ensure product quality of a highly scalable complex cloud solution. Title: Software Development Engineer in Test
Description:
Job Posting
Software Development Engineer in Test
Schedulicity started with an idea: to make online scheduling easy. We build calendar solutions for microbusinesses and pride ourselves on bringing great experiences to our users. We love our customers, and they love us back. Our solutions are used by thousands of businesses and consumers nationally, allowing our providers unlimited access to new clients, while empowering them to manage their business more efficiently.
Schedulicity Inc., the leading online scheduling platform for small service-based businesses, is looking for a full-time SDET to join our team.
The Role
As an SDET, you will join one of our agile teams within our product development department. Your team will consist of a product owner, engineers, UI/UX, a QA associate, and yourself all working together to design, implement, and produce top-notch quality features for our web application, iOS applications, and Android applications. You will be responsible for the end-to-end automation of test cases for all application platforms as well as assisting with the continuous advancement of our automation processes.
Responsibilities
Create and maintain automated UI test cases to provide full testing coverage – this includes automated tests for web and native (mobile) applications
Reduce the need for manual testing
Maintain testing repositories and feature branches as needed to coordinate with the release cycle and deployments
Report on automated test results
Review pull requests for the web and native (mobile) repositories
Grow and maintain thorough knowledge of the Schedulicity application
Collaborate with peers in engineering, product, and design to release high quality features
The Technology
Our Web app is an Angular application so our E2E automation framework utilizes Protractor, a Node.js program which runs on the Jasmine test framework. Protractor is a wrapper around WebDriverJS. All Web application tests are written in JavaScript.
Our iOS and Android applications are developed in their native languages, Swift and Java/Kotlin, respectively. However for the E2E automation of said native apps we use a Node.js solution to provide parity to our web application automation. We run our tests against the Appium server with the WebdriverIO test framework. All iOS and Android tests are written in JavaScript.
Having experience or knowledge in the following is a plus:
Experience with Web Single Page Applications
Native application experience (iOS and/or Android)
Experience with Protractor, Appium, Selenium or similar technologies
Proficient in JavaScript or similar languages that transfer easily
Experience with Angular or a similar JavaScript framework
Our Development Process
We work effectively in distributed teams—using Slack, Zoom, and Google Meet to collaborate across the globe.
Our teams practice Agile methodologies—either using Scrum or Kanban as best fits the team. Work is scoped, tracked, and refined using Jira by Atlassian.
We use Azure as our web code repository and BitBucket as our native code repository and require all code to be peer reviewed before a pull request is approved.
Qualifications/Work Experience Requirements
BS CS/EE/CE, or 1+ years of experience as a Test Engineer
At this time, Schedulicity cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.

Title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
Senior Quality Assurance Engineer - Artisan Technology Group, Kansas City, MO
Do you want the opportunity to innovate with one of the best teams in Kansas City and dig into complex QA problems? Our Solutions teams are growing, and we’re hiring a Sr. QA Engineer. If you’re looking for a career where you will be empowered to have autonomy in your work and advance your technical skills, you’ve come to the right place.

Artisan is committed to building quality solutions for our clients. It is our core belief that creating quality software requires a good team of QA Engineers to break what we build so we can make it better. QA Engineers at Artisan are more than manual testers – we believe in automation and repeatability.

As a Sr. QA Engineer for Artisan, you will be responsible for understanding the vision, business drivers, and problems of our clients to create a suite of both manual and automation tests to ensure the solution meets the client’s objectives. The Sr. QA Engineer also uses their knowledge to communicate test criteria and testability to development teams to influence better design, bug prevention strategies, privacy policies, to incorporate the run of tests as part of the CI/CD development process, and to guide other QA in best testing practices.

We have:
Technology Leadership where collaboration and innovation are fostered
A culture where every Artisan has the opportunity to lead, experiment, as well as, succeed and fail safely
A focus on empowerment, integrity, community, and flexibility
Opportunity to work with innovators in the early stages of ideas, products, or platform
A collaborative team committed to providing our clients with technical solutions to resolve complex business problems
Ability to transform an industry
Learning new things (every day!)
You should have:
Knowledge of development practices and patterns, as well as ex-programming experience preferred.
Experience in working with automation frameworks and designs.
Experience testing front-end web applications built on Angular, React, Ionic, or similar web frameworks.
Experience in working with back-end web applications. (API’s)
Must bring a great attitude and a passion for your craft!
Knowledge of non-relational databases, such as MongoDB and Elasticsearch, as well as knowledge of relational databases such as PostgreSQL and MSSqlServer.
At least 5 years of experience in automation testing is desired.
Experience writing test automation scripts using tools such as Selenium Web Driver, Protractor, Appium, Katalon Studio.
Experience debugging websites written in HTML/CSS/JavaScript.
Experience testing mobile applications for both iOS and Android - Native and Hybrid.
Cross-browser testing experience to ensure consistent platform experience.
Familiarity with Security Testing or Security scanning software and how to evaluate results.
Experience with Load and Performance Testing and how to evaluate the results.
Experience writing test automation scripts to exercise web service endpoints.
Experience with data-driven testing.
Experience navigating and understanding the basics of Windows, Linux, MacOS, iOS, and Android operating systems.
Experience with Agile/Scrum software methodology
Experience using JIRA, GitHub, and other defect tracking tools, as well as agile project management tools.
And by the way, we’re not stuffy and corporate around here. We protect our culture and care about your work environment. Because of that, we offer perks and benefits such as . . .

You are a QA Analyst with 2+ years of software testing experience and will bring your technical skills and industry best practices of manual and automated testing to our agile teams. As the Sr QA Analyst you will test user interfaces and micro-services running in a cloud environment.

2+ years of Scrum/Agile experience, including working on teams following scrum/agile methodologies using scrum/agile and defect management tools like: Rally (preferred), JIRA, Mantis

Experience contributing to test automation efforts with exposure to test automation tools and frameworks: Selenium (Python), unittest, SOAPUI (Groovy scripting desired), Bamboo, Bitbucket
Experience with cross-browser testing
Experience with software release/build processes

Experience with SQL SELECT (including JOIN queries), INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer - Backend Engineering
Description:
About Us
BlueOwl is a separate company in the State Farm® family of companies and the solutions provider for HiRoad Insurance, an InsurTech brand that recognizes and rewards good choices. Operating independently with the backing of the #1 auto insurer in the country, we blend the best aspects of a tech startup and an industry leader. To see what we’ve helped build so far, check out HiRoad.com.

Our Vision
At BlueOwl, we envision a world where data driven behavior fuels better lives. We started with the reinvention of insurance and a bold mission to create a data science powered platform that actually helps people become better drivers. We aspire to be the best in the business at identifying low-risk drivers by harnessing the power of data with an innovative technology stack.

It’s a big goal, and that’s where you come in. We're growing a world class team of data science, engineering, design, product, marketing and mobile technologists because we know that the key to success isn’t just about nailing the technology—it’s hiring the talented people who will help us make a quantifiable impact.

The Role
We are seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Engineer to join our team. In this role, you'll be responsible for working with the product team creating test plans, test cases, and performing testing activities to support backend development from end to end. You'll collaborate with design and engineering teams early in the process to ensure utmost quality in the core insurance platform.
Responsibilities:
Support our product teams with strong communication and collaboration.
Design test plans and test cases to support the product through the entire SDLC.
Participate in design and engineering review, giving feedback on testability and impact with existing features and systems.
Create, update, and maintain test cases against both development and production systems.
Perform manual tests on new and regression features
Analyze test results in automated testing
Partner with QA Management to improve test processes.
Proactively learn and adapt to the automated test development process.
Minimum Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience in Quality Assurance
Previous experience in testing API contracts and flow based business logic
Knowledge of API testing tools (such as Postman and SoapUi) or cURL Ability to write test plans from complex business requirements, seeking information from product and engineering when needed.
Strong analytical skills, able to identify efficient testing approach to explore all vulnerabilities in the system
Understanding of integrated systems and being able to participate in discussions with product and engineering about feature changes or additions that have an impact on related and unrelated systems.
Understanding of QA processes and methodologies, and the ability to adapt or identify when a new approach is required.
Experience with QA activities across multiple development pipelines and
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in the P&C Insurance or similar industries
Understanding of logging and debugging
Additional Details:
Salary: We pay competitive salaries factoring in experience, skill set, and location. We do not offer equity.
We provide a wide-selection of health and welfare benefits including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and supplemental income plans. We also offer a 401(k) Plan with a company match.
Wellness and Time Off: We provide Headspace subscriptions, a wellness allowance, and generous time off including four weeks of PTO in the first year of employment with additional time granted upon hire.
New parents may also take eight weeks of fully paid parental leave (plus four weeks for parents who give birth) which may be taken within one year after the birth and/or the adoption of a child.
Professional learning and growth: We provide a generous allowance each year for professional learning, continuing education, and career development.
Location: May work from anywhere in the US, but will need to be actively available during core meeting hours from 9:00AM - 3:00PM pacific time to collaborate with team members across all time zones. Some travel may be required after the San Francisco office re-opens.
Candidates based in the SF Bay Area will be able to commute to the SF office for in-person meetings and other gatherings. Frequency TBD.

Title: QA Engineer
Description:
Clinical Trial Media advances new medical treatments and medication options globally by recruiting patients for clinical research studies. CTM continues to be one of the fastest-growing companies on Long Island, having doubled in size in the last year, while expanding its service line and revenue stream.
We are looking for an experienced QA Engineer to join our growing technology team and help us build products that make a difference. You will have the most important role in ensuring that our products meet the expectations and requirements of the client by reporting issues and locating bugs. Not based in NY? That's ok, working remotely is acceptable. If you are an exceptional QA Engineer, we want you on our team!
Our v2 tech stack is go, js/ts, reactjs, kubernetes, github, azure.
Benefits of a full-time position at CTM include competitive compensation, health insurance including medical, dental and vision, 401k employer matching contributions, paid time off, life insurance, state-of-the-art office space, extensive job training, team building activities throughout the year, and a positive work environment that fosters on-going professional development. CTM is experiencing unprecedented growth and rapid expansion and offers a multitude of opportunities for growth and upward mobility.
Responsibilities
· Work with the engineering team to QA production and test builds
· Perform UAT on web portals, apps, dashboards, microsites and other digital products
· Write clear and concise bug tickets outlining the issue, expected results, and test parameters
· Produce reports on issues and provide constructive feedback to the engineering and technology teams
· Conduct manual fuzz testing on dashboards and UIs
· Interact with github CI/CD pipelines
· Work closely with management and team leads on priorities and timelines
Qualifications
· 2+ years of QA experience on a large web product
· Experience with github and QA pipelines
· Experience with task management software and creating tickets (bugs) for a dev team
· Experience with automated testing tools like Selenium and Cypress
· Detail oriented and excellent time management
· Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment while supporting multiple projects
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Additional Desired Skills
· Coding experience (go, javascript, or python)
CTM’s mission is clear – to help advance the discovery of new medications and treatments through clinical trial awareness and participation. Almost 80% of new drugs never meet development timelines and this is all due to a lack of patient participation. CTM plays an important role in the drug development cycle by helping to minimize clinical trial delays due to patient enrollment. CTM offers customized products, services, and flexible solutions that are vital to successfully enrolling patients into clinical trials worldwide.
In addition to its business goals, CTM cares deeply about company culture and places a priority on employee happiness. CTM employees enjoy fun activities, contests, games and parties throughout the year all while working in a brand-new, state-of-the-art office. The company also gives back to the community through group volunteering events, donations and charity fundraisers.
Fun Facts about CTM:
· Our CEO, Cara Brant, is an independent owner focused on patient outcomes and employee success. She was recognized as one of the Top 50 Most Influential Women in Business on Long Island for 2019.
· CTM has established 25 years of success stories in clinical trials across 30+ countries.
· CTM was awarded Best Place to Work 2019 from the Long Island Business News.
· CTM created COVID19ClinicalTrial.com as a resource for information about ongoing COVID-19 clinical research to provide clarity and hope for thousands of subscribers.
· Our Creative team has been recognized with multiple awards.
o 2020 Telly Award Silver Winner in the General – Non-Broadcast category for our CTM Capabilities Video.
o 2019 Telly Award for Regional Television in the Health and Fitness category.
o 2019 W3 Silver Award for Healthcare Website Design

Title: SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test) Remote
Description:
Drips is looking for a qualified Software Development Engineer in Test to join our team. You will be hired to ensure quality and stability of our entire architectural stack, from APIs to web.
As a SDET, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end testing, automation frameworks and common test tools. You should also be a team player with an acute attention to detail. If you are also familiar with Agile methodologies, we would like to meet you. This is a remote position.
This is a remoteposition, applicant must reside in:
AZ/CA/CO/FL/IL/IN/IA/MA/MI/NV/NM/NC/OH/TX/UT
Role & Responsibilities:
Creates and maintains automated test cases, executes test suites, reviews and diagnoses reported bugs, and ensures overall system quality.
Develops, maintains, and troubleshoots automated suites of tests.
Works with development team to derive testing requirements.
Reproduces, debugs, and isolates problems and verifies fixes.
Works closely with software developers to create software artifacts including test plans, cases, and reports.
What We Are Looking For:
2+ years of experience working as an SDET.
Experience with C# and code repositories.
Experience creating test plans and generating test cases using test plan management tools.
Experience with modern test frameworks and tools including Selenium.
An automation first testing mindset.
Experience reviewing requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
Good technical foundation with ability to pick up new skills and adapt quickly.
Desire to learn new technologies while supporting existing.
An ability to think up new ways to break our applications.
A commitment to the software craft and things like code reviews, design patterns, etc.
What Will Set You Apart:
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent written and oral communication.
Solid C# developer
Azure experience including DevOps.
TestRails experience.
Agile/Scrum
GIT
SQL
Core Values:
Drips core values are central to how each employee executes in their role daily and exceeds. Below are how we exceed in each core value
Lean – We find the right mix between administration and simply doing things. Over complicating tasks can add time without providing benefit, however just doing things without a plan can add time when course correction is required. To exceed, we finish work in a timely manner while reviewing to make sure we are striking the right balance between the two. Implementing streamlining methods to existing processes ensure we evolve and stay lean.
Passion – Expressing passion daily is the desire to do the job but evolving in the job to expand beyond the base role and taking on additional projects and roles to help teams outside your own while maintaining your individual workload. Understanding that all of the activities we take are to enable our clients, and thus Drips as a whole to be successful. Asking the question, “How is what I am doing today, enabling the success of my teammates and my clients”.
Happiness – Finding the balance in both your personal and work life. Participating in group and team activities as you see fit but understanding that life is about more than just coming into the office daily. Drips has overall wellness programs and additional benefits that assist. True enthusiasm for what we do is essential but comes from understanding the business overall and how we fit into it.
Improve – Never accepting the status quo and being entrenched in a process or workflow. Finding ways to streamline and innovate while bringing those improvements to leadership. Improvement also means understanding the anticipated benefit and it improves our daily working experience, your teammates, and Drips Clients overall.
Team – We support and assist our teammates, even if it is outside of our typical duties. We take on additional projects for their added value whether they impact your day-to-day work or not. Being part of a team involves being in close contact every day, respecting each other and the work we do is essential however to exceed in Team, we move outside of our direct team, to the company team as a whole and understand how we impact everything and the value we provide.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Software Development Engineer in Test
Description:
Classification (FLSA): Exempt
Position Type: Full time
Reports to: SDET Manager

Description:
QGenda is a fast-growing Atlanta-based healthcare software company, with an amazing corporate culture, where we strive to be the best place to be a customer. Our software is used by thousands of hospital departments around the world to automatically generate the most optimized physician work schedules to accommodate complex business rules and accurately schedule the appropriate medical provider based on their skill level, specialty, availability, and preferences.
As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET), you love writing test automation and are delighted when you troubleshoot and fix an issue or automate something. At QGenda you will advance our automated testing capabilities to deliver high-quality software to our customers. This includes designing, developing, and maintaining automated tests for our web and mobile applications. You will solve exciting and unique testing challenges and leverage the latest tools and processes. You will play an integral part in driving innovative solutions and shaping our automation approach as a champion of quality on the SDET team!

Job Duties & Responsibilities:
Build and Maintain Automation
Build automated test suites to exercise our web application using C#, NUnit, and Selenium using a Page Object Model
Build and maintain our mobile testing framework using Python and Appium
Build and maintain backend tests using RestSharp and Postman
Build and maintain AWS Synthetics Canaries in JavaScript
Analyze product requirements and determine the level in the test pyramid and the testing framework where test cases best fit
Investigate new tools and processes to enable efficient, effective, automated testing
Provide solutions to common day-to-day testing problems by analyzing integration and regression testing failures
Collaborate on building internal tools to ensure quality at enterprise customer scale
Deliver High-Quality Software
Execute automated tests and report on results throughout the development life cycle
Champion delivering high-quality software releases across our web and mobile platforms while shifting testing left
You may work with developers and QA as part of a Scrum team or on the SDET team to advance our automated testing efforts
Participate in Code Reviews, including reviewing other SDET’s code
Requirements:
2+ years of experience writing automation tests
B.S. in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or Computer Engineering from a major U.S. university
Experience writing code in an object-oriented programming language, C# or Java preferred
Experience with Selenium and Appium or a similar automation framework
Experience writing API tests using RestSharp, Postman, or similar
Source control, Git experience
Knowledge of test methodologies and automation strategies
Beginning understanding of performance testing
Familiarity working with both Mac and Windows operating systems
Experience working in CI/CD, Continuous Test, or Agile/Scrum environments preferred
Experience with AWS, Selenium Grid, or Docker preferred
Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and upbeat personality

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A roll-up-your-sleeves quality analyst / tester who wants be part of a collaborative environment? Title: Quality Engineer
Description:
The Quality Engineer is a key contributor responsible for performing quality management practices to satisfy software acceptance criteria and/or test requirements using industry leading tools and techniques. Working to support an iterative Agile team, the Quality Engineer identifies and drives innovative testing and test automation approaches that turn ideas and concepts into reality.
Duties include: Identifying test scenarios and components, while planning and executing tests with a focus on test automation. This requires expertise with a variety of test automation methodologies, practices and procedures with a dedication to high-quality, and efficiency for maximum velocity. We are looking for someone who is outcome focused, loves challenges, can work collaboratively and who exemplifies the virtues of our talent model: Humble, Hungry and Smart.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate as a member of an Agile/Product Development team to define and implement testing and test automation strategies and techniques
Maintain and extend automated tests and test automation frameworks
Determine and manage required test data
Work collaboratively to optimize test coverage
Partner with DevOps teams to onboard automated tests – to stay consistent with an infrastructure established to support continuous testing
Support team member knowledge-sharing and skills transfer, to increase team productivity
Qualifications:
BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
3+ years of experience as a Quality Assurance Test Automation Engineer
Experience with different development and testing techniques (i.e. Test-Driven Development, Acceptance Test Driven
Development and Behavior Driven Development) – a plus
Experience with test automation design, development practices, frameworks, and related tools that support unit, integration, functional and non-functional test automation
Hands on experience with Selenium using Java
Ability to work with Agile methodologies in a fast pace environment required Knowledge of cloud technology, DevOps and Jenkins preferred
Experience testing dynamic web pages (HTML5), relational database technology and XML/JSON desired
Experience testing REST services desired
Demonstrates a craving for continuous self-improvement, through understanding of new technology innovation and its application
A sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company’s success
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Team player with great time-management, interpersonal and communication skills
Travel to Prudential sites up to 10%
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.
Note that this posting is intended for individual applicants. Search firms or agencies should email Staffing at staffingagencies@prudential.com for more information about doing business with Prudential.
