Title: Integrations Specialist (Remote)
Description:
An integration specialist assists client success account teams and clients in strategic planning, architecture, building, and support of client integrations
Essential Responsibilities:
Guide account teams and clients in understanding integration best practices
Participate in requirements sessions to discover integration needs and work with account team and client to plan and architect integrations
Understand and document detailed requirements and use cases
Work with the product development team to decide priority and timing of integration work
Manage and prioritize needs across various clients
After release, provide support, training, and education
Contribute to the overall quality of integrations by verifying features are built correctly and according to design and requirements
Ensure success of client integrations

Ability to work on multiple projects at once, set priorities, work independently, problem solve, improvise, and function as part of a team
Aptitude for learning, using, and training on sophisticated software systems

Experience working with development and technical teams
Prior experience working with REST API’s and familiar with JSON
Superior communications skills, both written and verbal
Team player skilled at both managing and working as part of a team

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer 2 - Engagement
Description:
About Highspot
Highspot helps sales teams improve customer conversations and achieve their revenue goals. From content optimization and performance analytics to in-context training, guided selling, and more, the Highspot platform delivers enterprise-ready features in a modern design that sales reps and marketers love. Using Highspot, marketing leaders have deep insights and analytics into the performance and influenced revenue of content, campaigns, and marketing assets. What makes the solution special? It’s loved by sales reps globally, and is the #1 rated sales enablement platform on G2 Crowd.

We are committed to diversity as both a moral and business imperative.

About the Role
We’re looking for a committed, dependable, self-driven, and unabashedly detail-obsessed Quality Assurance Engineer 2. You will be part of our growing QA team, responsible for performing black and grey box testing, and developing and maintaining automation scripts. The right candidate is technical, eager to learn about our product, and able to help us quickly get new features to market.
What you’ll do
Execute manual and automation tests for both web and mobile applications.
Plan test efforts and maintain test documentation (test plans, test cases).
Participate in testing new features as part of the Engagement feature crew.
Find and report defects in the Jira issue tracking system.
Review and help troubleshoot customer reported defects.
Drive quality standards and constantly improve testing processes.
Partner and collaborate with a variety of teams in Product, UX, Support and Services departments.
Extensively test new features before release to ensure they meet Highspot’s high quality standards.
Participate in Regression testing.
Understand Highspot’s customers and be an advocate for their ideal experience.
Your Background
Knowledge of software testing methodologies and Agile processes.
Experience with industry-leading test automation tools such as Selenium, TestCafe, and WebDriverio
Experience with modern web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), fundamentals of database design and management, and REST APIs.
Experience testing CRM integrations.
Exceptional troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities.
Strong planning, organizational, and communication skills.
An entrepreneurial spirit: agile, creative, resourceful, and tenacious in solving problems and achieving team and company goals.
B.S. in Computer Science (or a related field), or equivalent work experience.
4+ years of hands-on experience testing SaaS software.
2+ years of hands-on experience creating and maintaining test automation suites.
Bonus skills: CI/CD tools, React, SQL, Salesforce, CRM
Benefits
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits
401(k) Matching
Paid parental leave
Flexible work and vacation schedules
Discounted ClassPass membership
2 volunteer days per year
Transportation benefits
Competitive compensation and stock options
Fully-stocked kitchen
Annual company-wide events
Meaningfully contribute to a compelling vision!

Equal Opportunity Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship, color, ethnicity, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or invisible disability status, political affiliation, veteran status, race, religion, or sexual orientation.

Title: Senior Quality Assurance Analyst – Technology Services
Description:
About Our Job
Employment Requirement : City Employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by September 30, 2021. All persons offered a position will be required to provide valid proof of vaccination prior to starting employment.
This posting will accept applications until August 29th. Please apply as soon as possible.
About Technology Services
The Technology Services Department (TS) of the City and County of Denver is using state-of-the-art technologies and methodologies to deliver and improve the systems, applications and operations that we deliver to our customers. Technology Services supports the people, agencies and ideas that make the City and County of Denver world class city. The City offers a unique opportunity to work with a diverse business and technology environment on a large scale as we employ over 13,000 people, of which 9,000+ are daily technology consumers in support of a diverse population in excess of 700,000 citizens.
About the Quality Assurance Team
The Quality Assurance (QA) team performs various QA activities (requirements review, risk analysis, test planning/strategies, test case creation, manual test execution, automation scripting, performance testing, and user acceptance test coordination) for various applications and integrations to ensure and validate that user expectations are met and that high quality value added solutions are being delivered.
Diversity in the City
The City and County of Denver is committed to cultivating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion. This commitment is woven into our values and belief that we are strongest when we embrace and celebrate our differences. We aim to have employees who are as diverse as our residents, with different perspectives and unique ways of thinking. If you share these values and our enthusiasm for equity, we encourage you to apply to join our team.
As a Senior Quality Assurance Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the planning, design, and execution of various types of testing on simple to complex implementations. The Senior Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst works collaboratively within the IT department and business units to execute and validate test cases based upon system requirements for our mission and business critical commercial off the shelf (COTS) applications and custom applications for the agencies that we support.
Additionally, the Senior Quality Assurance Analyst will:
Participate in the planning, development, and implementation of automated business systems in an effort to align information technology solutions with customer requirements and initiatives
Review user requirements documents to ensure that requirements are testable
Develop test plans, test cases, automated test scripts, and test reports on multiple concurrent projects of varying size and complexity
Plan and execute different types and levels of testing on various software applications
Validate that user expectations are achieved during the testing process
Coordinate and lead User Acceptance Testing activities with both internal and external end users
Track and report progress of defects and risks to stakeholders and provide suggestions on risk mitigation
About You
We are looking for someone with some or all the following skills and experience:
At least five (5) years of manual testing experience
At least two (2) years of recent experience with automated testing, to include: building, executing, and maintaining automated test scripts in Selenium, Katalon Studio, and/or Visual studio
At least one (1) year recent experience with API testing, to include: building, executing, and maintaining API scripts in SoapUI and/or Katalon Studio
Experience creating and maintaining standard testing deliverables such as test plans, test strategies, and test cases
Experience with coordinating end user testing
Experience with developing and executing stress/performance testing (experience with Apica Zebra Tester is a plus)
Experience with various defect tracking tools such as Azure DevOps, JIRA, and/or ALM
Experience in advising customers on the utilization of best practices within the technical landscape
Have a collaborative and team-oriented work style
Ability to be self-organizing and self-starting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Have excellent problem solving and analytical skills
A strong customer service focus
Experience with process and change management
We realize your time is valuable so please do not apply if you do not have at least the following required minimum qualifications:
Education Requirement: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Business Administration, Mathematics or a related field.
Experience Requirement: Three (3) years of professional level experience working on an integrated technology software system development and/or production support team. Two (2) years of this experience must have included performing project leadwork for routine projects and/or projects that are limited in scope as a member of cross-functional teams to address and analyze business requirements and automated systems issues, along with other development of all aspects of assigned projects.
Education and Experience Equivalency: One (1) year of the appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for each required year of post-high school education.
Additional appropriate education may be substituted for the minimum experience requirements.
About Everything Else

Title: Test Automation Engineer, Python
Description:
We have been retained by our client in Dallas, Texas to deliver a Test Automation Engineer with Python experience on a full-time, direct hire basis to work onsite, in downtown Dallas, Texas. Work remote two (2) days a week. Provide software test automation and software quality assurance. This client makes significant profit doing what they do best. There is a new technology product underway inside this cutting edge organization to create a Software as a Service offering, in addition to what they do best.
The Test Automation Engineer will be responsible for creating automated test cases for our client’s custom applications hosted in AWS. The test cases are created for API calls as well as websites, RESTful services, RESTful API, as well as .NET web applications.
Understand business requirements well enough to design test cases
Implement automated test cases for new functionality of our client’s custom .NET, SQL AWS applications and services that drive our client’s core business using Python, Selenium, Pytest, and collaborate with developers on CI/CD pipelines in AWS.
Develop test cases for all supported browsers and platforms
Collaborate across .NET development team, AWS DevOps team, and project management team and business users
Responsible for working with the latest test automation technologies in a fast-paced environment
Requirements:
3+ plus years of hands on Python or test automation creation in Python
2+ years of Selenium test development
2+ year of Pytest (desired) or equivalent (JUnit, XUnit, any unit test frameworks)
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience
Desired Skills:
Pytest
Selenium
AWS continuous integration and continuous deployment pipelines
Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with developers and devops team to solve complex tasks
Agile methodologies
Ability to translate requirements into test cases, functional tests, regression tests, and edge case tests and automate those tests with Python test framework.
Employment Type: Regular Full-Time, Direct-Hire
Salary Range: $110,000 - $140,000 / year
Benefits: life, health / medical, dental, vision, 401k matching, paid vacation, paid holidays, paid sick days. strong benefits. excellent total package.
Location: Dallas, Texas - near downtown Dallas.
work remotely from home up to 2 days a week
Immigration: US citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor H1b candidates at this time.
No third parties. No consulting firms. Principals only.

Title: Quality Assurance Analyst - IV - Remote
Description:
QUALITY ASSURANCE ANALYST - IV
Dallas, TX

ICS is hiring an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst for our Client in the Downtown Dallas area! This is a key role in the testing, planning, and executing the delivery of quality software applications. The Quality Assurance Analyst will apply knowledge to collaborate with the project teams and design engineers in order to ensure all phases of the project development life cycle are up to company standards.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:
Develop and execute formal test plans to ensure the delivery of quality software applications
Be involved in test planning, writing test cases and scripts, test case automation and test execution
Define and track quality assurance metrics such as defects, defect counts, test results and test status
Collect and analyze data for software process evaluation and improvements, and integrates them into business processes to address the needs of the business
Establish an automation framework using Selenium.
Translate manual regression test cases into automated test scripts.
Execute automated and manual test cases to verify functional and non-functional requirements.
Participate in daily stand-ups and weekly project team meetings.
Develop test cases and test scripts for enhancements and new features.
Participate in developing test strategies, test plans and test estimates.
Identify defects and proactively communicate them to the project team
SKILLS / EXPERIENCE YOU NEED:
Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Information Systems Management, or related degree preferred
Experience performing functional, non-functional and regression testing for web applications.
Experience configuring a Selenium Test Environment. (Webdriver, Eclipse/IntelliJ IDE, TestNG)
Proficient in building automation frameworks using Selenium.
Proficient developing and executing test scripts using Selenium with Java or JavaScript.
Experience using Zephyr as a test management tool.
Experience working on projects using an Agile or iterative development methodology.
Understanding fundamental Software Quality Assurance activities.
Basic SQL skills to query a database and validate test results
This position requires that candidates fall within one of the following citizenship categories:

Title: Sr Test/QA Analyst - TAMPA FL
Description:
Join the team that's revolutionizing the way America votes!
About Tenex
Tenex Software Solutions is a Tampa-based software company that is seeing immense growth!
Our award-winning Precinct Central product is being used by some of the largest local governments in the US. It has been acclaimed as the most user-friendly electronic voter check-in solution in the industry. Our platform continues to grow and it has resulted in a number of new openings.
We are looking for people that are passionate about technology, support, and good customer service who are excited to work on large scale applications used by millions of people, and driven to expand their knowledge and learn new technologies. Tenex strives to be the leader in the elections software domain and aspires to be 10x better than the next best.
Responsibilities
What You Will Be Doing
Writing and conducting manual AND automated testing on web and mobile applications
API testing
Perform front-end and back-end validation with thorough regression testing
Writing test cases
Understanding large software modules and business requirements
We are looking for a skilled Senior Quality Assurance Analyst to write and conduct manual & automated test scripts for our web and mobile applications. This person will ideally have experience with front end, API, web and mobile testing using Selenium/Appium/Cucumber/Postman.
The ideal candidate will be expected to participate in the full software lifecycle of our cloud and web-based solutions focusing on quality assurance and testing them from the mindset of a user. The major part of the assignment will be quality assurance and product testing on web and mobile platforms. Candidates are expected to execute and create applicable test cases, identify issues within solutions, analyze code and databases to pinpoint sources of error based on working with a small close-knit group of architects, developers and subject matter experts in the US election market.
The ideal candidate will need to understand large software modules, be required to participate and contribute to design and development of user experience, and analyze processes to maximize efficiency and ease of use. Candidates will be expected to be logical thinkers and be able to keep up with changing user requirements and fast paced priorities. We are seeking candidates with a strong ambition to grow and learn with a focus on user interface aesthetics and to apply good quality assurance methodologies.
Responding to technical support tickets.
Talking directly to the customer to determine the nature of their issues.
Connecting to the customer’s computer system via remote access.
Identifying the nature of the hardware, software, or networking issue.
Providing the customer with resolution choices.
Installing new hardware systems, software upgrades or networking cables.
Fixing any software or hardware issues.
Providing technical or operational training.
To offer recommendations — based on various metrics — on how to improve the support process in its entirety
Traveling to train/support customers on their systems
Required Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Software Engineering, Information Sciences or a related field
2 - 5 Years QA/Testing Experience, preferably in web and cloud-based applications
Critical thinking, detail oriented, agile and creative with time management
Excellent verbal/written communication skills
Thrives in a team environment and able to multitask
Self-motivated and superior work ethic
Required Skills and Proficiency
Experience in mobile and web testing
Performance Testing Experience
Ability to use and develop effective test cases
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure quality throughout the development life cycle
Knowledge of SQL
Exploratory and functional testing experience
Experience in post-release/post-implementation testing
Experience in current test tools and strategies
Tenex offers competitive pay and a very generous benefits package including health insurance, dental, life, vision and more. Salary offer will be commensurate with experience.
We want team players that are committed to their career and strive for excellence and push themselves to be 10x better than the rest.
NO AGENCIES PLEASE!
Only actual job seekers need apply. Thank you!

Title: Sr. Frontend Engineer - CWPP (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role
We’re building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we’re responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it, and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.
The candidate will join our Cloud Workload Protection (CWPP) which is a brand new and a key product area for CrowdStrike. We’re extending CrowdStrike’s mission of “stopping breaches” into the public cloud and cloud-native workloads. CrowdStrike’s CWPP offering will give customers the ability to monitor and track their cloud-native workloads as well as hardening and protecting them against attacks prior to deployment. This offering will help with defending against potential adversary activities involving cloud-native resources. When coupled with Falcon, CrowdStrike’s CWPP offering will provide a more comprehensive perspective on how the adversary is targeting key customer infrastructure. Our ultimate goal is to provide a single platform for securing the entire lifecycle of cloud workloads.
Our stack is Ember, but if you’ve used frameworks like React or Angular, you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers, we can push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term “big data”. In close collaboration with analysts & clients, you’ll get to see the apps & visualizations you’re building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.
What You’ll Need
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, AngularJS, Backbone, or React/Flux.
Experience with testing frameworks, tools, and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI, etc.
Comfortable with Git/version control workflows.
Bonus Points Awarded For:
Experience creating or contributing to open-source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with coaxing that last frame-per-second out of browsers.
Experience with cross functional collaboration with designers, developers and product owners
Lead Initiatives in projects while working with junior developers
#LI-DK1
#LI-Remote
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation policy
Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
Paid parental leave, including adoption
Flexible work environment
Wellness programs
Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats
We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
At Tickets.com we are changing the landscape of the live sports and entertainment industry. Tickets.com delivers innovative, cutting-edge technologies to enable safe, unforgettable fan experiences in venues across the globe. We are assembling a world-class technology team to build platforms and products that anticipate emerging opportunities, including dynamic pricing and offers and digital, contactless ticketing. The Tickets.com mission is to provide premium, innovative live experiences for our clients and their patrons.
Company Overview:
At Tickets.com we are changing the landscape of the live sports and entertainment industry. Tickets.com delivers innovative, cutting-edge technologies to enable safe, unforgettable fan experiences in venues across the globe. We are assembling a world-class technology team to build platforms and products that anticipate emerging opportunities, including dynamic pricing and offers and digital, contactless ticketing. The Tickets.com mission is to provide premium, innovative live experiences for our clients and their patrons.
Role Description:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer with experience testing web-based applications and services in a fast-paced environment. This engineer will be responsible for the testing of web-based applications and services supporting our ticketing systems, be adaptable and keep up with new tools and technologies. They will have familiarity with modern QA practices: "Shift-Left", "Shift-Right", QA-Ops, Security, Performance, Automation (Selenium) as well as extensive expertise with open source test tools.

Be passionate about providing industry leading user experiences
Ability to interface with all levels of employees in different groups
Ability to work both independently with little supervision and in a team environment Must be articulate and communicate effectively, both in written and oral formats
Exercise troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and organization skills
Ability to maintain and meet schedules
Technologies and Experience:
Bachelor of Science in Engineering or Computer Science (or equivalent) is required
At least four (4) years of hands-on Quality Assurance experience:
Strong knowledge of Modern QA methodologies, open source tools, CI/CT, and AGILE process.
Experience writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
Some experience using automation test tools (Selenium) and / or performance test tools (Performance Center)
Candidate must have hands-on experience testing web-based application, REST services, API, Database, Reports supported in a device agnostic and responsive environment.
Candidate must be very detailed focused with an emphasis on quality & end-to-end testing.
Ability to write queries to perform data validations or set-up test data.
Experience working with offshore teams.
Knowledge of Ticketing systems, Access Control systems is a plus.

Key technical traits:
JIRA, TestRail
Proficiency in JavaScript, Junit, SQL, and testing for REST services
Understanding of AGILE methodologies
Some experience with Selenium, Performance Center.
All in-office positions are subject to MLB's mandatory Covid-19 vaccine policy.

Title: Lead QA Engineer (100% remote-Selenium)
Description:

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer - Mobile & Web
Description:
Delta Defense is the private company that provides Marketing, Operations and Customer Care for the USCCA. The USCCA, saves lives through education, training and self defense insurance for responsible, American gun owners.

Delta Defense, LLC, is one of the fastest-growing companies in America.
Inc. 5000 company TEN years in a row!
Journal Sentinel Top Workplace - 6 years in a row
Milwaukee Business Journal Top Workplace - 5 years in a row

We are a fun, fast-paced and rewarding place to work and grow!
Position Summary:
We are looking for a QA Engineer to assess software & native mobile application quality through manual and automated testing. In this role, you should have a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills, as well as knowledge of native mobile application interactions. If you are also competent in designing, writing, and executing test cases and are passionate about quality, we'd like to meet you. Responsibilities and duties include the manual & automated testing of new software and new native mobile application builds in both the pre- and post-release stage of the development lifecycle. Ultimately, you will ensure that our applications and systems work correctly.
Duties/Responsibilities:
Define and create test cases based on acceptance criteria and in conjunction with best practices established by our overall QA team.
Determine test case candidates for automation, providing the appropriate validation as defined in the test case.
Write automated integration and/or UI tests to be included in the regression suite.
Participate in executing manual test cases, where required as well as release regression testing.
Review acceptance criteria and discuss with the developers to determine unit test case coverage.
Participate in the code review process ensuring unit tests have been implemented based on the predetermined acceptance criteria unit test coverage.
Advocate for quality within cross-functional development teams.
Actively work with developers on test automation best practices.
Update and maintain an automated regression test suite while expanding UI functional test coverage.
Contribute to our test frameworks and services.
Coordinate testing efforts to ensure the delivery of quality features.
Contribute to our long-term vision and strategy for QA and Test Automation.
Make testing an integral part of the development process.
Report bugs and follow them through the complete bug life cycle
Review new Mobile Application builds on both Android and iOS devices to ensure the builds follow the design patterns for those devices.
Skills/Abilities and Education Requirements:
BS in Computer Science or equivalent
2-3 years of related Quality Engineering, Software Engineering experience
Javascript experience required
CodeceptJS experience is a plus!
Knowledge and experience with native Android & iOS application and their design patterns
Experience writing test plans and test cases are required
Experience working with automation tools such as Selenium is required
Superior problem-solving skills.
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to identify and resolve problems
Demonstrates the Core Values of Delta Defense, LLC
PM19

PI144316940

Title: Software Engineering - ACE 3
Description:
As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally.
Expertise in various technology delivery concepts including Domain Driven Design, API oriented development, microservice and event based architectures, and automation are key. You will work on a team building cloud based solutions leveraging modern patterns with implementations in both our private and public cloud platforms. The primary responsibility will be the delivery of software as an agile team member. Additionally, the software engineer will champion leveraging modern technologies including cloud backed APIs, microservices and DevSec culture.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
Advanced knowledge of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Understanding of architecture and design across all systems
Working proficiency in developmental toolsets
Knowledge of Auto industry-wide technology trends and best practices is a plus
Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages
Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement
Prior experience building internet scale web service/API platforms from the ground up. Strong understanding of OOP & SOA principles, Enterprise design patterns and industry best practices. Strong understanding of domain driven design, Microservices patterns and architecture. Experience with Spring Boot Web Services on cloud platforms.
Experience with Java eco-system and associated tooling (Core & EE, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Cloud), UI/UX (React JS, Angular or equivalent), Web Technologies (JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS, JSON, REST, SOAP)
SCM / DevOps / CI/CD tools & process (GIT/Bitbucket, Maven, Ant, Jenkins, Sonar), Testing tools & frameworks (Jasmin/Karma, JUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, Mockito), Agile Methodology and Tools (JIRA)
Strong understanding of Java concurrency, concurrency patterns, experience building thread safe code. Expert level experience designing and building REST web services using Java @ internet scale. Experience with building messaging, event-driven architectures. Experience with high volume, mission critical applications. Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
Thorough knowledge of SDLC. Previous experience working in financial services. Experience with IBM MQ, Apache Kafka. Experience working with no-SQL databases like MongoDB, Cassandra and Knowledge of industry wide technology trends and best practices.
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. Description:
#Location - US/Remote
About iconectiv
Your business and your customers need to access and exchange information simply, seamlessly and securely. iconectiv’s extensive experience in information services and its unmatched numbering intelligence helps you do just that. In fact, more than 2B people count on our platforms each day to keep their networks, devices and applications connected. US Citizenship Required

Proven ability to write automation to verify data structures, data formats, and data values

BDD (Behavior Driven Development) type testing
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain code repositories, preferably using GIT
Experience with Agile/SCRUM processes and techniques

Experience with automation practices leveraging commercial collaborative tools like Helix, JIRA
Strong ability to create and design test automation and test infrastructure - 3+ years in a Software Engineer or Software Engineer in Test capacity ideal
Strong written and verbal communications skills.
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent with 5+ years of working experience.

Title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer - 18090203
Description:
Job Title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
Department: SW
Region: Sunnyvale
COMPANY DESCRIPTION:
We’re a Silicon Valley based startup, developing smart sensing solutions for real-time 3D mapping and object detection and classification.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Quanergy is disrupting several industries with our unique combination of hardware and software. As a member of our software team, we're looking for someone who can work under minimal supervision, define test procedures and collaborate closely with Developers, Designers, Customer Support, and Engineering Leadership. If this challenge excites you, we’d love to hear from you.

Defining, planning, developing and executing test plans that assure product feature functionality and reliability and meets expectations for our Automotive and Security product lines.
Understand high-level requirements in the S/W Product Requirements Documents and the details of the required features specified in Jira.
Collaborate with the S/W R&D group to ensure that the requirements for features are defined clearly.
Work with other S/W QA Engineers in QA processes, product requirements and formulation of test cases etc.
Full lifecycle QA experience – in this role you will design both manual and automated test cases, execute tests, analyze the results, report and track defects, and ultimately make the decision on test completion.
Always look for ways to improve current QA processes to ensure effective time management and best product quality.

S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

5+ years of experience with Software Quality Assurance, software development, testing and test automation experience.
Strong understanding of QA Process & Methodologies in relation to testing embedded systems.
Should be able to use programming language to write basic scripts. (eg sending API requests, automating everyday tasks).
A solid background in software quality assurance testing, including the ability to integrate QA into projects from the design and planning phase.

Excellent organization, writing, communication and interpersonal skills, and high self-motivation.

Experience with Python testing frameworks (Selenium, unit test, pytest, nose, etc.) and automation tools for both front end and APIs.
Experience with Continuous Integration CI concepts, and use of CI tools (Jenkins, etc.) as a platform for executing and reporting on automation.
Experience with GRPC API.
Experience on Squish (FROGLOGIC)Automation tool preferred .
Knowledge of BDD/TDD framework.
Experience with containers (Dockers/Kubernetes).
Available for immediate start.

Lull is a Santa Barbara based e-commerce company –one of the fastest growing companies in the space. Our engineering team is responsible for developing a suite of cloud-based software systems. Lull's technology is fueling rapid growth by streamlining, automating, and innovating systems that enable constant improvement throughout the business. We like to set the bar high, roll up our sleeves and work together to outperform the competition. We are highly invested in the communities we serve through our community outreach programs by donating time, products, and services both locally and nationally. Collaborate with marketing, logistics, and other stakeholders to verify our test cases are covering their critical business functions
Continue to extend our existing test suites utilizing Postman, Selenium and Ghost Inspector

6+ years of professional experience on test automation
6+ years of professional experience with Selenium and/or similar
4+ years managing software releases
Deep expertise on all the different testing phases and methodologies

Excellent communication & organizational skills
Exceptional knowledge and experience with git (branching, PR, etc)

Experience managing testing device farms

Title: Software Development Engineer in Test
Description:
Introduction
Software Developers at IBM are the backbone of our strategic initiatives to design, code, test, and provide industry-leading solutions that make the world run today - planes and trains take off on time, bank transactions complete in the blink of an eye and the world remains safe because of the work our software developers do. Whether you are working on projects internally or for a client, software development is critical to the success of IBM and our clients worldwide. At IBM, you will use the latest software development tools, techniques and approaches and work with leading minds in the industry to build solutions you can be proud of.

Your Role and Responsibilities
In the role as a Software Development Engineer in Test you have the ability to be creative and innovative. You work well independently and as a team player while providing help to develop automated test systems for IBM Security. In this role you are forward thinking about industry standards and methods for testing and automation technologies. You apply these standards and technologies to ensure that our offering meets the defined availability objectives for our customers.
You have knowledge of what represents good software design.
Develop reliable, maintainable, and well-functioning testing frameworks and code.
Create architecture that focuses on the testability, robustness, and performance of the system under test.
Identify, assess, and mitigate risk in the software design life cycle.You are flexible and agile to changing system requirements and expectations.Perform root cause analysis of defects and issues found exposed during testing.
Engage in ongoing learning development with cutting edge software and design practices.
Keep current with industry trends.


Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Software coding experience.
Familiarity with JavaScript, Python, or Java.
Understanding of Automated Test frameworks.
Experience in all phases of the development process.
Familiarity with Agile Software Development methodologies.
Hands-on experience creating test cases.
Solid foundation with Cloud technologies.
Background in problem solving, root cause analysis, and method reproduction.
Self-starter, team player, quick learner.
Excellent written and verbal communication and problem solving skills.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
Java, Javascript or Python.
Testing Frameworks such as Selenium or TestNG.
Software Tester or Quality Assurance Engineering experience.
Writing automated test cases.
IBM Cloud Services a plus.

About Business UnitIBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?

Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.

Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location StatementIBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:

12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.
World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.
Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.
Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).
Select educational reimbursement opportunities.
Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.
Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.
Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

Title: Senior Software Quality Engineer
Description:
Join a team that puts its People First! Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.
Job Summary
**Open to remote candidates**
As a Senior Software Quality Engineer, you will join a multi-functional product team and implement test strategies to ensure product quality of a highly scalable complex cloud solution. Successful candidates have experience working within an Agile delivery model and can plan and execute tests that use the latest tools and automation frameworks. Qualified candidates will have a minimum of 5 years of experience in the Software Quality Engineering (or related) field, with experience creating tests within one or more automation frameworks. Conduct test case reviews and ensure requirements traceability, proper coverage
Write code to perform automated tests
Share knowledge and help build skills of other team members

5+ years of functional testing background, including defining test strategy, test planning, test case design, and execution

Title: Sr. Frontend Engineer - CWPP (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role
We’re building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we’re responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it, and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.
The candidate will join our Cloud Workload Protection (CWPP) which is a brand new and a key product area for CrowdStrike. We’re extending CrowdStrike’s mission of “stopping breaches” into the public cloud and cloud-native workloads. CrowdStrike’s CWPP offering will give customers the ability to monitor and track their cloud-native workloads as well as hardening and protecting them against attacks prior to deployment. This offering will help with defending against potential adversary activities involving cloud-native resources. When coupled with Falcon, CrowdStrike’s CWPP offering will provide a more comprehensive perspective on how the adversary is targeting key customer infrastructure. Our ultimate goal is to provide a single platform for securing the entire lifecycle of cloud workloads.
Our stack is Ember, but if you’ve used frameworks like React or Angular, you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers, we can push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term “big data”. In close collaboration with analysts & clients, you’ll get to see the apps & visualizations you’re building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.
What You’ll Need
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, AngularJS, Backbone, or React/Flux.
Experience with testing frameworks, tools, and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI, etc.
Comfortable with Git/version control workflows.
Bonus Points Awarded For:
Experience creating or contributing to open-source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with coaxing that last frame-per-second out of browsers.
Experience with cross functional collaboration with designers, developers and product owners
Lead Initiatives in projects while working with junior developers

#LI-Remote

Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation policy
Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
Paid parental leave, including adoption

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

Title: Senior Automation & QA Engineer
Description:
Digital Air Strike is seeking a passionate, enthusiastic, and inspired technologist for the role of a Senior Automation & QA Engineer.
The ideal candidate should be a detail-oriented team player with a broad technology background who can collaboratively contribute with the support and engineering teams to solve complex technical problems.
This is a great opportunity to develop skills in SQL, Python, C#, Java and other technologies while working in an exciting startup environment with a dedicated & experienced team. The position will entail working with a fast-paced team of engineers, product managers, and stakeholders who are all responsible for supporting and enhancing our existing suite of applications and services.
Job Responsibilities
Work with automotive inventory providers to ensure we are receiving high quality inventory data for our systems.
Work with project and release Managers to synchronize, organize and supervise testing activities for overall project releases.
Work to establish best practice processes and toolsets to ensure consistency in process for QA peers.
Work alongside software engineers and data engineers, as well as less-technical members of the Digital Air Strike team, to troubleshoot and solve problems.
Actively collaborate with the management team and developers to clarify business requirements for optimal testability, and consistency.
Help create and oversee end to end complex automation process and testing infrastructure.
Help Drive functional, unit, regression, performance, and all standardized testing practices.
Help support existing code standards while supporting all processes for automated testing Use SQL queries and procedures, as well as Digital Air Strike's own internal tools, to troubleshoot, solve technical problems and manage inventory data ingestion.
Help Architect Testing pathways, user stories and cases derived from business requirements.
Familiarity with NoSQL technologies.
Familiarity with Mobile development testing and associated Frameworks
Use third party dashboards to aid in identifying issues.
Support and enhance website-crawling technologies written in C#, Java, and JavaScript.
Provide world-class customer service to our internal and external clients.
Create test scripts while reviewing and enhancing current testing paradigms.
Provide guidance for automation test tools, frameworks and process improvements for policy establishment, maintenance, and pipeline deliveries.
Prepare documentation to support testing procedures, policies, and processes.
Job Qualifications
Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.
Experience investigating and troubleshooting complex technical problems in a fast-paced environment.
Proactive and analytical thinking.
Test Scripting experience.
Regression and Negative testing experience.
UI & Compatibility Testing experience.
Data Interface and Migration Testing experience.
Performance, Load, and stress testing experience.
Defect and Bug tracking experience.
Experience querying data with SQL or similar database technologies.
Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio Code, or other industry standard IDEs.
Ability to learn quickly.
Excellent written and oral English communication skills.
Ability to prioritize and execute on tasks that have competing priorities.
Be a self-starter comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.
Education
One of the following:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, 0.or a related field from an accredited university.
Advanced technical education from a recognized program.
Demonstrated technical knowledge and equivalent work experience.
Bonus Points
Experience working with software development teams and client support teams.
Experience with Python or other programming and scripting languages.
Experience with Jira software.
Experience with Azure DevOps
Experience with Selenium or other Automation testing suites
Experience writing technical documentation including system diagrams and how-to articles.
Entrepreneurial / prior Start-Up experience
Automotive and Digital Marketing experience
Benefits
Company-sponsored Medical/Dental/Vision plans, long-term disability and life insurance, incentive stock options, 401K plan, employee assistance program, flexible spending accounts for medical and dependent day care, tuition reimbursement, veterinary care discount program, student loan refinance and match program, generous vacation and sick time allowance, 10 paid holidays, summer bonus 1/2 day off per month, anniversary day off, monthly awards with prize drawings, alternate schedules offer Friday afternoons off and a really cool office environment including beautiful outdoor patios with lounge chairs, massage chairs, free lunch Fridays, ping pong, monthly social events and much more.
Equal Opportunity Employer
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Automation Test Engineer Manager
Description:
Summary
Are you looking for opportunity to work in a high-growth digital health startup environment? Are you passionate about being a part of an innovative team and not afraid to roll up your sleeves and dig in? Are you interested in transforming the multi-billion-dollar healthcare industry? If so, we want you to join our team!
At Point Health™, we are building the first healthcare navigation and healthcare shopping platform to help make healthcare easy to find, easy to understand, and easier to afford for health consumers. Our core values of Acting with Integrity, Striving for Greatness, Being Bold, Bringing Passion, and Moving as One give you a sense of what our culture is like.
Opportunity
The Manager of the test automation team will be an integral member of our development team. As a Manager, you will be responsible for growing and managing a team of QA Automation Engineers to contribute to the overall quality of our product portfolio. This role will define, implement and lead quality assurance processes (functional and performance testing), testing environment buildout, testing methodologies and the training and selection of industry standardized tools. This is a great opportunity to both learn and bring your own experiences to help improve our technology and practices.
Some of the things you’ll do
You’ll help document, implement, and manage quality automation processes. You’ll be jumping in and bringing various stakeholders in the development team together to ensure timely execution on tasks and assignments.
You’ll deeply understand company processes. Whether it’s simple or complex, you’ll help dig into our existing processes and identify the areas that need improvement and help prioritize projects in alignment with our company objectives and needs.
You’ll collaborate regularly using confident communication, and documentation. You understand the importance of communicating clearly and organized documentation, and don’t mind taking the time to do so.
You’ll build and design the department. You have a proven track record of building and leading a new team with a strong emphasis on development and training.
You’ll help grow our company culture. Culture is a vital part of any company, and you’ll get to help our culture by hiring top talent individuals who display our company mission, vision and values.
We’d love to hear from you if
7+ years of relevant management and testing experience.
Experience with designing test automation framework from the ground up or redesigning an existing framework in a significant way to increase reuse and reduce development and testing efforts.
Hands-on experience with various tools used for load testing, security testing, programming languages, test automation technologies, and API testing.
Experience with monitoring and alerting tools such as Grafana, Loggly, AWS Cloudwatch etc.
Experience with Selenium, Cucumber, Appium, Eggplant, Subject7, TestComplete, Lambda Test, or any of the automation test tools.
Support developers with unit, component, commit, build and deploy, CI/CD test automation as needed.
Experience with Continuous Integration tools like Jenkins, CircleCI, and AWS Code Deploy.
Be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Start-up experience is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent working experience
Additional Information:
Flexible schedule
Monday to Friday
Unlimited Paid Time Off Policy including Employee Birthday
Medical Insurance with options that cover the employee’s responsibility 100%
Dental Insurance covering employee’s responsibility 100%
Vision Insurance
Access to Karis Health Choice
401(k) Matching
HSA Matching
Company Sponsored Lunch Service (In-office only)
Temporary Remote Work

Title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
What Gallup automation quality assurance engineers do:
Work in a highly collaborative culture with developers on Gallup Access
Design, plan, communicate and execute an automated testing strategy in a fast-paced agile development environment
Identify and adopt new testing methodologies, best practices and tools to improve test coverage and greatly reduce the need for repetitive functional testing
Create and maintain automation scripts
Perform automated tests and communicate problems, test results and the status of projects
Debug, troubleshoot and analyze the root-cause of product failures and anomalies
By helping ensure flawless software releases, you’ll be a part of changing the world a little to a lot every day. Learn more about the innovative online platform you’ll be testing at https://my.gallup.com .
Who we want:
Logical problem-solvers with a systematic approach to diagnosing, communicating, documenting and fixing errors in software programs to ensure a flawless software release
Organized multitaskers who demonstrate extraordinary attention to detail while working on multiple automation QA projects at once in a fast-paced agile methodology environment
Proactive strategists who identify processes and procedures to automate and use an automated issue-tracking system to track testing
Engineers who are comfortable with code and regression testing
Strong communicators who can clearly articulate their findings and collaborate with developers to ensure Gallup is meeting all business and technical requirements

Working knowledge of back-end QA processes and the ability to script using Selenium, JMeter or Postman required
Experience with browser UI and API test automation tools
Experience setting up automated test scripts for the application data layer or data-heavy applications
Ability to develop automated test cases and scripts from requirements and other supplemental specifications
Ability to stress test web UIs and web services and troubleshoot and update automated scripts
One year of experience with 508/WCAG/ADA testing preferred
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence preferred
What we offer:

The creative and innovative feel of a startup with the stability and credibility of a well-established brand

A robust benefits package including medical, dental and vision insurance options; a 401(k) retirement and savings plan with company matching; and an employee stock ownership program
A beautiful downtown office on the Missouri River that boasts 50 acres of land

Title: Software Developer in Test II
Description:
Job Description
This Software Developer in Test collaborates with the development team in the testing strategies and plans for our Computer Aided Dispatch Software. They will engage in both manual and automation testing to continually improve application efficiency and performance. This role will also help to train and support more junior team members and handle higher risk areas of the software.
Job Duties Include:
Basic creation, execution, and maintenance of automation test cases
Review test cases and test scripts to ensure suitability for automation
Work with the development teams to understand how changes in the software design/architecture affect the test automation program
Design, write, edit, and modify simple and complex test cases
Estimate, prioritize, and plan testing activities
Identify test conditions, both positive and negative, from User Stories, Product Backlog Items and other requirements documents
Create manual test cases with pre-conditions including machine state, configuration and data, and action steps which exercise the code and expected results for successful execution
Execute manual test cases, document results, update progress, and track bugs
Execute automation scripts, interpret automation test run results, and author simple automation test cases
Identify defects in software under development and work with the development team to verify that defects are eliminated and tests are in place to verify and preven
Proactively select Product Backlog Items and commit to timely delivery
Provide detailed reporting of results, defects, and risks identified during testing of all assigned projects
Participate in the production of software documentation and release notes
Support their team in the delivery of work against the agreed upon definition of completion
Prepare for, attend, and participate in all Agile meetings, working to uphold Agile principles
Demonstrate working software to stakeholders
Prioritize workflow in accordance with departmental goals and initiatives
Provide technical assistance in automation related challenges to more junior team members
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
2-5 years of professional QA automation or development experience
Proficient in identifying, designing, developing, and maintaining simple and complex test cases and test suites
Proficient in executing automation scripts, interpreting results, and authoring simple and complex test cases
Able to design tests that do not have existing patterns
Proficient with Selenium and Visual Studio
Good understanding of modern test methodologies and processes
Proficient with a relevant programming language
Proficient SQL skills and database experience, including designing tables, databases, and queries
Good understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle
Good understanding of Agile Scrum values, principles, and practices
Self-starter who can work independently in a self-managed team environment
Ability to collaborate with team and across departments to deliver results on time and within scope
Assist, support, and train entry level QA Developers as needed
Understand the value of effective communication and works as part of a team to promote communication within it
Relevant certifications a plus, but not required

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
About the Company
At AT&T, we’re connecting the world through the latest tech, top-of-the-line communications and the best in entertainment. Our groundbreaking digital solutions provide intuitive and integrated experiences for millions of customers across online, retail and care channels. Join our mission to deliver compelling communication and entertainment experiences to customers around the world as we continue to evolve as a technology-powered, human-centered organization. As part of our team, you’ll transform the way we deliver a seamless customer experience with digital at the center of all you do. In our world, digital is much larger than just an eCommerce channel, we are transforming all channels to digitally perform as one team to create a better customer experience. As we move through 2021, the digital transformation will revolutionize the digital space and you can build a career that will propel your future.


About the Team
Position Overview

AT&T Digital Platform Product team is looking for a Full stack Developer (FE heavy) who is passionate about the eCommerce industry and has analytical and multi-task abilities to thrive in a fast-paced environment. As a Lead Engineer, you will be responsible for the design and development of various initiatives for AT&T’s customer and employee digital experience across our consumer distribution channels. You will lead the software product development life cycle from inception to production launch and post-production support. You must possess strong technical background to ensure you are designing modular & scalable web components, you must have experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects and have a well-rounded technical background in current web and micro-service technologies.


About the Job
Responsibilities

Hands-on Design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems

Track record of projects completed on time – you are a flawless executor, not a procrastinator.

You find satisfaction in a job well done and want to solve head-scratching challenges.

Experience with all phases of the software development life cycle, best practices and Agile Software Development.

Work with Leads, Engineers, Architects, Product Managers, and Business stakeholders to identify technical and functional needs of systems based on priority.

Writing great quality code with a relentless passion for automated testing and validation.

Enforce company policies in the areas of development methodology, architecture, security, change and configuration management and compliance.

Perform complex engineering activities for web performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support.


Responsibilities and Day-to-Day View
esponsibilities

Hands-on Design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems

Track record of projects completed on time – you are a flawless executor, not a procrastinator.

You find satisfaction in a job well done and want to solve head-scratching challenges.

Experience with all phases of the software development life cycle, best practices and Agile Software Development.

Work with Leads, Engineers, Architects, Product Managers, and Business stakeholders to identify technical and functional needs of systems based on priority.

Writing great quality code with a relentless passion for automated testing and validation.

Enforce company policies in the areas of development methodology, architecture, security, change and configuration management and compliance.

Perform complex engineering activities for web performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support.














Required Qualifications

5+ years related experience with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field.

4+ years in web markup, including React, HTML5, CSS3 and javascript

4+ years of experience with client-side scripting and javascript frameworks such as jquery and React

2+ years of experience in server-side rendering using NextJs

Proficient understanding of javascript pre-processing and packaging frameworks such as babel and webpack

Good understanding of Java, Nodejs, microservice and some full stack experience. While you’ll be spending most of your time in the V of MVC, we’ll occasionally need help further back in the stack

Good understanding of SEO principles including web analytics and ensuring that application will adhere to them

Excellent communication skills and experience in collaborative environments

The desire to be continually learning about emerging technologies/industry trends



Preferred Qualifications

4+ years of understanding of CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS

2+ years of experience in build and CICD technologies: GitHub, Maven, Jenkins, Sonar

2+ years of experience in Unit and Function testing using Junit, Spock, Mockito/JMock, Selenium, Cucumber, SoapUI or Postman

Experience working within Agile/Scrum/Kanban development team

Familiarity with HTML5, JavaScript frameworks, and CSS3

Excellent written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated ability to present complex technical information in a clear manner to peers, developers, and leaders



Technical Skills

ReactJs, NodeJs, Html, Java, Nodejs, microservices, cloud, REST services, NoSql technologies (Cassandra/MongoDb), knowledge of Redis/Hazelcast, Git, Jira, Jenkins



AT&T is leading the way to the future – for customers, businesses and the industry. We're developing new technologies to make it easier for our customers to stay connected to their world. Together, we’ve built a premier integrated communications and entertainment company and an amazing place to work and grow. Team up with industry innovators every time you walk into work, creating the world you always imagined. Ready to #transformdigital with us? Apply now!

Title: Materials Management Software Developer
Description:
About GM

There's never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won't happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM's global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GMIT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value.

For this developer role within General Motors, you are responsible for developing software applications using sound, repeatable, industry standard methodologies. You will work hands-on writing software or solutions, based on detailed requirements and system specifications. Additionally, you will work with development activities will include:
Updating existing software and/or developing new software solutions to address a specific need or solve a business problem.
Contribute to all development activities in accordance with appropriate methodologies and application of a repeatable, systematic and quantifiable approach to the development process.
Develop your skill further by working closely with more senior developers to ensure code alignment with design patterns/frameworks.

Responsibilities:

Job Description

You will need to have proven experience in the following:
Full lifecycle application development using standard design patterns/frameworks
Must have experience as part of a software project delivery effort
Demonstrate mastery of several programming languages, tools and/or technologies
Assists with Performance tuning, usability assessment/improvement
Proactively engage in the identification / remediation of software issues such as code quality, pattern mismatch, and security issues related to the code or solution/configuration
Integrate software with existing software/systems
Knowledge of Software testing, quality assurance and solutions testing including automation
Knowledge of maintaining and debugging live software applications
Work closely with senior developers, software engineers and/or data scientist to gain additional knowledge and expertise.
Document software solutions and ensure that technical documentation meets GM standards
Understand and maintain compliance with GM standards and industry standard methodology
Holds themselves and others accountable for demonstrating GMs values and cultural behaviors.
Models GM behaviors and crafts a winning culture.

Additional Job Description

Qualifications:
Minimum 3-5 years of experience designing, developing, documenting, testing, and debugging new and existing software systems and/or applications across the development lifecycle.
Experience with unit testing patterns and methodologies.
For Web Service developers we are looking for:
Required skill with Java using Spring frameworks or Quarkus and fundamental understanding of domain driven design patterns.
Experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL Microsoft SQL and Oracle.
Experience with deploying artifacts using CI/CD concepts and Microsoft AzureDevOps.

For UI developers we are looking for:
Required skills with native JavaScript or Typescript, CSS, HTML and experience with Web Components, Node, Angular, or other similar JS frameworks.
Experience writing automated unit tests using Protractor or Selenium.

We are not able to accommodate international relocation

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statements

The policy of General Motors is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or veteran status. Additionally, General Motors is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us atCareers.Accommodations@GM.com. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
