Title: Sr. QA Automation Engineer
Description:
Job Description

About us, but we’ll be brief
Experian is the world’s leading global information services company, unlocking the power of data to create more opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to work for. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been named in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.
What could be more exciting – personally and professionally – than being part of a disruptive business?
We at Experian pride ourselves on building new markets and leading the pack through continuous evolution and innovation. It’s a position ECS has enjoyed for more than a decade and we aren’t looking to stop now.
Experian Consumer Services is driven to provide the user with the knowledge and solutions to improve and protect their financial health. We pride ourselves on being at the frontlines of financial technology by putting our consumers in control of their credit. Join us in creating new experiences and make an impact on the tens of millions of consumers visiting our sites. We have a unique opportunity for a Sr. QA Engineer to join this dynamic organization!
What you’ll be doing

Analyze, design and implement programs.
Create, maintain & execute complex manual tests on web applications backed by Java, .NET, RESTful and SOAP APIs, SQL Server, Dynamo DB and batch files.
Create, maintain, execute, and analyze results for keyword-driven automated tests to ensure efficient and sufficient regression test coverage of ECS’ product portfolio.
Potentially help extend/maintain test automation libraries
Troubleshoot, isolate, and document problems encountered during testing.
Support QA analysts with script creation & execution questions/problems.
Generally, help improve testing processes, tools, and methodology.

Qualifications

What your background looks like
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar field from an accredited four-year university required.
7+ years of QA Engineering experience or Software development experience.
3+ years of hands-on experience with test automation using, Cucumber, Java and/or Selenium.
5+ years of experience testing complex n-tier web applications at all tiers (GUI, API, and DB).
5+ years of testing relational and/or NoSQL databases a plus.
Experience with test automation best practices (selectors, page objects, modular scripting).
Experience with enterprise test automation frameworks and automated test design.
Experience in an Agile, continuous delivery environment.
Hands-on experience with source control systems, such as GIT or TFS (branching, merging, etc.)
Object oriented software/web/API development experience (e.g. C#, Java, Python, or JavaScript).
Basic understanding of software design patterns.
Insightful and logical problem isolation & problem solving skills.
Very focused & methodical with good time management/multi-tasking skills.
Experience using Jenkins to drive automated testing.
Experience with Splunk.
Experience with Business to Consumer (B2C) & Business-to-Business (B2B) high volume batch systems and high traffic websites, focusing on ecommerce.
Financial Services experience is a plus.
Perks

During this pandemic, all Experian employees are working remotely. Once it’s safe to do so, we’ll slowly return to our offices however we are in no rush to do this. The safety of our employees is of utmost importance.
3 weeks of vacation to start, five sick days and two volunteer days (plus eleven paid holidays)
Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package, with a bonus target of 15%
Flexible work schedule and relaxed dress code

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Our goal is to create a thriving, inclusive and diverse team where people love their work and love working together. We believe that diversity, equity and inclusion is essential to our purpose of creating a better tomorrow. We value the uniqueness of every individual and want you to bring your whole, authentic self to work. For us, this is The Power of YOU and it ensures that we live what we believe.

Title: Quality Analyst
Description:
Description: Quality Analyst
Entrega is a leading provider of Application Design, Development and Delivery services to global clients. Our team of professionals use their expertise and experience to deliver results for our clients that address their most important business challenges.
The Software Quality Assurance Analyst provides, develops and implements tests that approximate real-world scenarios and ensure tested products are delivered with quality. They will also assist in the writing and implementation of automated and manual regression tests to run against existing products. They may work with our Business-team members to identify use-cases from business-cases to isolate and define test-cases to build test-plans. We are looking for detail-oriented, self-starters with a passion and a drive for quality.
Job Description & Responsibilities
Debug software products through the use of systematic tests
Develops, modifies, supports, executes and automates software test plans and scripts
Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action
Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software
Report test results to key stakeholders
Troubleshoot testing failures
Responsible for compatibility testing, smoke testing, regression testing, functional & non-functional testing, and user acceptance testing
Provide UX feedback that allows for customer-centric decisions to make the product more useful, useable, and desirable
. Requirements:
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor's degree; Computer Science or related field preferred; a graduate degree is a plus
Minimum 2+ years of related experience
Experience with automation frameworks like Selenium IDE
Familiar with major browsers and their developer tools on various computing hardware

Personal Attributes and Competencies
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment
Capable of managing multiple tasks and projects simultaneously

Demonstrated ability to solve problems and formulate recommendations
Excellent communication skills
Exceptional attention to detail

Passion for learning and personal growth, specifically when it comes to technology

Self-starter with high degree of integrity, and professionalism

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description:
Interfolio is on a mission to build smart, inspired and useful products for faculty and academic communities. By building an engine for faculty activity, decisions, and data, Interfolio has become the first mover in defining and category of faculty-focused technology that cultivates goal-oriented collaboration around academic decision-making.

Interfolio operates the first holistic faculty information system to support the full lifecycle of faculty work, from job seeking to review, tenure, sabbatical, committee work, research, and beyond. Offering colleges and universities increased and insight into faculty data to help achieve their strategic initiatives, Interfolio believes that advancing the faculty will advance the institution.

What’s even better than that? We’ve crafted a fun, collegial, dynamic culture that celebrates team and individual success almost daily. We’ve got a lean team of super-smart, super-hard working, local and remote colleagues who collaborate closely to produce a valuable service for an industry we’re passionate about. And, we genuinely like working with each other and with our clients.

Like what you’ve heard so far?

Then consider joining our Engineering team! The Interfolio QA team is excited to continue to grow within the organization and expand our automation efforts.

Location: The position is a fully remote position (within the continental United States), with opportunities to travel for quarterly onsite meetings 4x a year.*

COVID-19 Special Update: Due to COVID-19, our employees are working remotely until further notice. For positions based out of one of our two offices, we will continue to work remotely until the company determines it is safe to return as per guidelines set by the CDC/WHO and other official advising entities in either the US or UK where our staff might be located. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community and will re-open our offices when it is safe to do so and all appropriate safety measures are in place. Travel for staff members has also ceased until the company determines it is safe to travel as per guidelines set by the CDC/WHO and other official advising entities in either the US or UK where our staff might be located.
Responsibilities
Ensure high quality software is delivered in each release
Build and maintain the test automation framework
Research and resolve any broken automation scripts that fail during execution
Support manual QA testing efforts in conversion of manual test cases into automated ones
Participate in agile scrum to inject quality into the entire software delivery lifecycle
Update test results in test tracking tool(s)
Participate in product backlog grooming sessions in order to develop an automation test strategy
Report, track, and manage any discovered defects to resolution
Write and understand complex SQL queries in order to perform backend (database) testing
Create defect reports
Detect defects as early in the life cycle as possible
Work effectively and collaboratively within the scrum team and with other members on the product team
Works within established standards within the QA organization
Requirements
Experience in an Agile development environment
Experience writing and executing detailed test cases, test plans and test design documents
2+ years of software automation experience in web/cloud services, applications, and platforms
2+ years of above experience, and/or application, system testing, or software design/development
Experience developing and executing manual and automated test suites based on engineering and customer specifications
Experience with application (UI/API/Unit) automation tools, BDD automation tools, monitoring tools, performance testing tools, and automation technologies
Solid experience with test automation frameworks like Selenium
In addition to a competitive salary, Interfolio offers a robust benefits package that includes medical insurance, unlimited paid time off, a yearly wellness benefit AND professional development stipend, and a fun company culture, which sets us apart! We look forward to you learning more about us!

Interfolio is committed to diversity and the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national, social or ethnic origin, age, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, family or parental status, or any status protected by the laws or regulations in locations where we operate.

Title: Software QA Analyst ( ReadyAPI )
Description:
ARGO is a leading provider of software and analytics solutions for both the financial services and healthcare industries. ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics.
The Software QA Analyst supports application and system software testing tasks to ensure customer satisfaction with application accuracy, quality, and adherence to standards. This role partners with product teams, development teams, and customers as an integral part of the software development lifecycle. This involves project-level reviews of requirements, test plan development, test case execution, test result analysis, defect reporting, system documentation, and supporting customer testing efforts.

This position must be worked from our Richardson, TX, Memphis, TN, or Toronto, Canada offices.:

What we are looking for::
A completed Bachelor’s degree within Management Information Systems (MIS), Computer Science (CS) majors are preferred
5+ years of software testing experience
3+ years of working with testing and development tools, ReadyAPI or Postman
Understanding Data Driven and API testing
Experience using SQL Server Management Studio to conduct data validation
Experience designing test automation frameworks and/or programs
Experience with QA functions within different SDLC methodologies
Communication skills that include ability to collaborate with co-workers
Ability to lead integrated QA projects and to technically and professionally mentor junior team members
Experienced in producing test plans, test status reports, test cases
Manage test processes through all phases of the SDLC for both Waterfall and Agile (SCRUM, KANBAN)
Experience using industry standard test management tools
Experience leading automated test execution is preferred
SQA certifications from the ASTQB is preferred for the position. ASQ or Six Sigma certifications are a plus as well
Ability to travel up to 10% at times
Work experience within Financial Services, Healthcare, or Fraud Software Solution industry is a plus



What you’ll do::
Analyzes requirement and design documents for quality
Identifies gaps and & ambiguities
Interprets and understands testability; taking lead in recommendations for specification quality improvement
Responsible for the core activities of the testing effort
Has in depth understanding of the value of ARGO’s quality services to increase revenue and deliver value to our customers.
Takes lead of testing activities so as to reduce risk, eliminate waste, discover defects, increase confidence in the fitness of ARGO software and provide information and expert analysis for project and product decision makers.
Understands and promotes test coverage improvements and eliminates waste by leading continuous enhancements to the ARGO test case library using specification-based, defect-based and experience-based testing techniques including pairwise, equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis, decision tables, cause-effect graphing, state transition testing and defect taxonomies and other appropriate techniques.
Client test management, with thorough understanding of the client’s requirements, identifies & analyzes recommendations regarding customization of product quality, testing processes, and may direct a larger cross-functional test team to conduct testing of complex implementations.
Understanding of progress; interprets issue reporting and resolution, produces status reports and makes recommendations on test strategy enhancements and modifications during complex projects.
Understanding of multiple lines of business, their product template quality, and teaches junior analysts to have advanced knowledge of the LOBs.
Designs, develops and executes complex, comprehensive test scripts with thorough understanding of data preparation and management so as to detect defects and direct confirmation testing.
Log and trace files error review. Make recommendations on root cause analysis
Takes lead to facilitate client testing success, as needed, including planning, execution, researching complex problems reported in UAT and production, and effectively communicating results with appropriate parties for efficient resolution. :
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Applicants for U.S. or Canadian based positions with ARGO must be legally authorized to work in the United States or Canada. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for any ARGO positions.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

ARGO transforms business processes for financial service providers and healthcare organizations using proven business models and software innovation informed by real customer challenges, breakthrough technology, and rich analytics.

Title: Director, Quality Assurance
Description:
Primary Location: 13693 S 200 W, Draper, UT, USA
Division: Cox Automotive
Job Level: Director/Senior Director
Travel: Yes, 5 % of the Time
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Day Job
Requisition Number: 216691
As the Director, Quality Assurance of Software Engineering, you will plan, develop and execute the overall quality assurance strategy for Cox Automotive Dealer Ops product offerings. In this role, you will be expected to collaborate with Engineering, Product Management, Client, and Business teams to foster a team-based approach to high quality. You will lead appropriate changes in toolset, processes, and practices to ensure high quality deliverables and outcomes. To be successful, you must be able to demonstrate leadership, coaching and mentoring skills combined with the flexibility of working in a dynamic, fast moving and fast growing product development environment.
Your Role:
Develop a product testing strategy covering long term and short-term recommendations and actions
Passionate about creating an enterprise-grade testing approach
Proactively maintain high quality standards through systematic metrics-driven test planning and test execution and driving continuous improvements appropriate KPIs
Influence through leadership a global team of engineers and software testers
Collaborate with team and ensure that software meets or exceeds specified standards and end-user requirements
Proactively provide functional, regression and integration testing of our products as well as certification across browsers and devices
Daily review and monitoring of de-risk activities from initiation through delivery
Define and own the QA methodology with metrics-driven continuous improvement; analyze metrics and implement continuous process improvement
Report current status and continuous improvement metrics
Help lead/drive appropriate adoption of SDLC processes
Qualifications:
10+ years of enterprise software product quality assurance experience including test planning, implementation and execution
7 years of experience in a leadership and management position for multiple QA teams and multiple enterprise software products

Collaborative but decisive personal style leader who is a highly effective communicator and problem solver

Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science

Title: Sr. Web UI Engineer (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role:
We’re looking for a Senior Web UI Engineer to contribute to the next generation of CrowdStrike’s multinational web and ecommerce platform strategy.
For the applications you’ll support on the Web and Ecommerce team, our stack is React, but we’re big into Ember too, so if you’ve used frameworks like Vue or Angular you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. Our ideal candidates are sensitive to the needs of the users of their software & love learning more about their tools every day. Get excited about new features in Chrome Devtools? Tested your work in screen readers? Ever lost half an hour getting an animation’s bezier curve to be just the right kind of bouncy? Looking for a challenge that’s out of the ordinary? Get in touch.
We’re building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we’re responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.
Apply with your CV and tell us a bit about why you would like to work at CrowdStrike and if you wish include links to your portfolio or projects you’ve worked on.
What You’ll Need:
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as React/Flux , Ember, AngularJS or Vue.
Familiarity with static site generation tools and methodologies, Headless CMS, SEO, web traffic analytics
Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing intuitive interfaces and workflows.
Comfortable with Git/Version Control/Continuous Integration.
Bonus Points Awarded For:
Experience creating or contributing to open source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with WordPress, WordPress Headless or custom WordPress plugin development.

Title: Architect I - Software Testing
Description:
UST Global® is looking for talented Test Lead who will be working with one of the leading technology providers in the US. The ideal candidate should have the ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment. The ideal candidate must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability and knowhow to collaborate effectively with domain experts and IT leadership team.
Role Context
The role requires hands-on QA expertise and the ability to take initiative and develop / evolve our internal QA processes. The right candidate will be able to analyze the internal applications landscape and determine what to test, the priority of those tests and the best way to test. This role requires tight co-ordination and partnership with business analysts, engineers, and testers both onsite and offshore.
Responsibilities
Establish and evolve formal QA processes, ensuring that the team is using industry-accepted best practices.
Oversee all aspects of quality assurance including establishing metrics, applying industry best practices, and developing new tools and processes to ensure quality goals are met.
Act as key point of contact onsite for all test aspects of releases, providing test services and coordinating with test resources offshore.
Lead and mentor QA team members as needed
Develop and execute test cases, scripts, plans and procedures (manual and automated).
Diagnose defects and track them from discovery to resolution.
Partner with engineering teams to stay informed of new technologies being introduced and ensure that system components are designed for testability.
Partner with offshore team to conduct performance tests as needed.
Provide testing support during production cutover (releases) as needed.
Required Experience
7+ years’ experience in the software testing or Quality Assurance field including hands-on test engineering experience (web application test experience preferred).
Ability to write select queries and a solid understanding of relational databases.
Demonstrated experience developing and executing test cases, scripts, plans and procedures to support various development methodologies
Familiarity with the software development life cycle and test cycles (Unit, Regression, Functional, Systems, Stress & Scale, Smoke & Sanity)
Understanding of multi-tier web application architecture and deployment
Understanding of existing QA best practices and methodologies to design, implement and automate processes
Experience working and partnering with an offshore team
Experience with Test management tools such as JIRA and test automation tools such as QTP or Selenium
Desirable Skills
Experience with marketing automation tools such has Hubspot, Eloqua, exact target, Adobe Campaign, Adobe Marketo.
CRM test experience (Salesforce, Marketo or Dynamics), Web services test experience preferred.
Quality certifications are a plus.
Force.com, XML schema validation or test experience is a plus.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
About the Company
At AT&T, we’re connecting the world through the latest tech, top-of-the-line communications and the best in entertainment. Our groundbreaking digital solutions provide intuitive and integrated experiences for millions of customers across online, retail and care channels. Join our mission to deliver compelling communication and entertainment experiences to customers around the world as we continue to evolve as a technology-powered, human-centered organization. As part of our team, you’ll transform the way we deliver a seamless customer experience with digital at the center of all you do. In our world, digital is much larger than just an eCommerce channel, we are transforming all channels to digitally perform as one team to create a better customer experience. As we move through 2021, the digital transformation will revolutionize the digital space and you can build a career that will propel your future.

As a Lead Engineer, you will be responsible for the design and development of various initiatives for AT&T’s customer and employee digital experience across our consumer distribution channels. You will lead the software product development life cycle from inception to production launch and post-production support. You must possess strong technical background to ensure you are designing modular & scalable web components, you must have experience leading large cross-organizational software development projects and have a well-rounded technical background in current web and micro-service technologies.

Track record of projects completed on time – you are a flawless executor, not a procrastinator.

You find satisfaction in a job well done and want to solve head-scratching challenges.

Experience with all phases of the software development life cycle, best practices and Agile Software Development.

Work with Leads, Engineers, Architects, Product Managers, and Business stakeholders to identify technical and functional needs of systems based on priority.

Writing great quality code with a relentless passion for automated testing and validation.

Enforce company policies in the areas of development methodology, architecture, security, change and configuration management and compliance.

Perform complex engineering activities for web performance tuning, monitoring, deployment and production support.


Responsibilities and Day-to-Day View
esponsibilities

5+ years related experience with a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field.

4+ years in web markup, including React, HTML5, CSS3 and javascript

4+ years of experience with client-side scripting and javascript frameworks such as jquery and React

2+ years of experience in server-side rendering using NextJs

Proficient understanding of javascript pre-processing and packaging frameworks such as babel and webpack

Good understanding of Java, Nodejs, microservice and some full stack experience. While you’ll be spending most of your time in the V of MVC, we’ll occasionally need help further back in the stack

Excellent communication skills and experience in collaborative environments

ReactJs, NodeJs, Html, Java, Nodejs, microservices, cloud, REST services, NoSql technologies (Cassandra/MongoDb), knowledge of Redis/Hazelcast, Git, Jira, Jenkins

Team up with industry innovators every time you walk into work, creating the world you always imagined. Ready to #transformdigital with us? Apply now!

Title: Senior Test Engineer / SDET
Description:
As a Senior Test Engineer/ Software Development Engineers in Test, you will develop, execute and maintain software to test the product. You are expected to have industry-leading technical abilities that enable you to significantly improve product quality. You should have a combination of solid in-depth knowledge of Quality Assurance, as well as knowledge of object oriented design principles. The test software you will build should expose defects in production level code as well as defects at the component and feature integration perspective. You should command the skill to communicate clearly and effectively.
A candidate will need to define automation strategy, automation cases as well as design tools for unit, functional, and system integration testing in a programmatic manner. In addition, you will also have the opportunity to propose improvements to our existing processes and automated tools in order to improve the team’s speed, quality and efficiency.
As a Test Engineer/ Software Development Engineers in Test, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies from front-end UI to back-end distributed web services. You will own the design and implementation of tests that will help in end-to-end quality of major deliverables working closely with multiple engineers and teams to execute them. Scaling, reusability, and customer experience are top priorities as the business grows.
If you enjoy broadening your technical skills, building a new tool, and working in an environment that thrives on creativity, experimentation, and innovation, then this is the job for you!
What does a great Test Engineer do?
The Senior Software Test Engineer (SDET) helps deliver the quality and performance of large scale, big data, custom hardware multi-platform software products that includes web, API and mobile application interfaces. Incumbents in this position are experienced, hands on and self-motivated engineer who can work collaboratively in a continuous integration environment. This role involves working closely with Software Developers that includes leveraging shift-left methods to understand a complex domain and product. The Senior SDET focuses on contributing to the development of automated Functional Integration tests and end-to-end tests through open-source test frameworks for overall system testing within an Agile environment. This position typically works under limited supervision and direction. Incumbents of this position will regularly exercise discretionary and substantial decision-making authority.

A passion for development, testing and design

Title: Quality Assurance Specialist
Description:
Overview:
Keypath Education is a leading global EdTech company that partners with the world’s leading Universities to develop, design and deliver the most career-relevant online education solutions.

We are a fast-growing, and fast-moving international team, who value collaboration, innovation, and lifelong-learning in our mission to unlock greatness in educators and their students, and solve our greatest global social and economic challenges.

Certified as a Best Place to Work by Crain’s Chicago Business and the Chicago Tribune, our Chicago office is home to about 300 full-time employees. In addition, we offer remote options. We gather teams of experts from digital marketing, course development, web development, finance and student service backgrounds to support university partners in the US, Canada, Australia, UK and Asia Pac.

Why join Keypath?
Not only do we pride ourselves on our ability to provide an incomparable experience for our students, but we also want to make sure our employees (we call them Keypathers!) feel the same way.

Overview
As a QA Specialist, you’ll join our team helping to deliver online courses for our partners around the world. You’ll be responsible for creating comprehensive QA plans and testing websites according to those plans as needed. The ideal candidate will employ curiosity, user empathy, and an attention to detail to find defects both within and beyond the requirements.
Responsibilities:
What you’ll be doing as a Quality Assurance Specialist
Develop software quality assurance plans.
Conduct functional testing and regression testing according to test plans and document results.
Communicate detailed defects to the project team in a bug tracking system – JIRA preferred.
Validate fixes and update test checklists as needed.
Verify built products against designs (screen mock-ups, business requirements, and technical specifications).
Proactively monitor systems/sites for errors and/or problems.
Participate in formal and informal reviews at predetermined points throughout the agile process to determine quality.
Examine and evaluate the software quality assurance process and recommends enhancements and modifications.
Qualifications:
4+ years of previous Quality Assurance experience for web-based technology projects.
Experience writing detail-oriented test plans and test cases.
Knowledge and familiarity with QA methodologies, processes, and tools.
Experience with cross-platform testing tools.
Experience testing for accessibility.
Ability to recognize and document problems with design and user experience.
Experience in agile software environments (SCRUM and Kanban).
(bonus) Accessibility testing certification (Deque, IAAP or other).
(bonus) Experience with automated testing frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Puppeteer, PHPUnit, etc.).

Additional Benefits Include:
Competitive array of Medical, Vision and Dental
Tuition Reimbursement
Partner Degree Program - earn a free degree from one of our partner institutions
401 (k) Retirement Matching Contributions
Paid Leave Policies
Paid Holiday Week Shutdown in December
Summer Flex/Family Flex Days
Volunteer Time Off
Professional Development Programs
Remote/Flexible Work Options

Title: Quality Assurance Automation Analyst II
Description:
The Quality Assurance Automation Analyst II position is responsible for creating and executing test plans in the Quality Assurance arena. The Quality Assurance Automation Analyst II primary functions include 1) Assist in quality assurance efforts for large projects and / or initiatives that involve multiple systems. This includes the development of test plans, test cases, and test execution; 2) Create Manage and Run Automation Frameworks and Scripts 3) Have an thorough understanding of the technology and processes of supported systems to allow for the development of effective test scenarios and plans that will assure that testing meets desired results: 4) Implement and utilize defined metrics and dashboards to measure testing status; 5) Understand the business processes related to supported systems to enable more effective communication and test case development; Work closely with analysts, designers, developers, and business SMEs to effectively assure delivery of a quality project. 6) Requirement and Design Review, Problem Solving and Troubleshooting
Support continuous improvement of team quality management practices, such as defect management, continuous integration, integration testing, and testing automation.
Creation of Automation Frameworks and Test Scripts that will act as a User of varying roles across a mix of our business and automation platforms. The scripts will build into an end to end test process that will document where the test has issues and record these in the Program Management platform Jira. The scripts can be used as part of regression, or part of a UAT UI tool that the business can use or even smoke testing by developers with a goal to provide automation at the functional testing level. Continuous improvement on Automation to combine with Micro Service architecture to reduce the time it takes to perform a complete regression run.
Primary Responsibilities:
Assist in Quality Assurance efforts for large projects and / or initiatives that involve multiple systems:
Develop / lead the development of test plans, test cases, and overall testing strategy including test automation plans with the Test Automation team.
Prepare test cases based on the analysis of business requirements, system functionality, white / black box testing requirements, and other criteria to support the quality goals of supported systems. Test cases typically include a description of the test case, inputs and outputs, and expected results.
Execute and lead the execution of test cases and report issues to the team.
Enter test case results for all testers into the issue reporting system report results to the team. Report any critical test failures immediately to team leaders and managers.
Participate and / or lead project / system release meetings by reporting QA results, notifying the team of any ‘out of the ordinary’ issues.
Communicate with and support any other testing groups, including off-shore teams.
Document test case coverage for a supported system or project.
Create and Run Automated Test Scripts to provide 100% Regression Coverage
Build Maven projects in Integrated Development Environments including Eclipse, IntelliJ and Create Tomcat environment, build and deploying war files, creating and updating shell script for custom properties
Creating GIT projects and maintaining the source code in Bitbucket, Jenkins etc.
Configure Selenium Test Environment by installing the Java, Webdriver, M2e and testNG version
Building Java classes with optimized and reusable Objects/Methods.
Use XPath and DOM to work with dynamic and static objects in Selenium
Perform Data driven testing using Selenium WebDriver and TestNG functions which reads data from property and XML, excel files
Understand the technology and processes of supported systems to allow for the development of more effective test strategies:
Develop a deep understanding of the technologies, system interactions, and processes of supported systems to allow for the development of more effective test cases and more effective issue identification and resolution. This includes vendor supported systems such as Salesforce, YEXT, Duda, Servly, SAP etc as well as internally developed systems such as Salesforce, Order Hub Sami and others.
Develop and achieve QA goals for systems and projects by working closely with stakeholders and the Release teams.
Provide leadership to the QA team in the development of effective communication plans for supported systems and projects:
Utilize strong written and verbal communication skills to develop comprehensive communication plans for QA supported systems and projects. This will include the development of appropriate metrics – based on project or system needs – to provide testing status.
Implement and utilize metrics to measure testing status and identify opportunities for testing and process improvement:
Understand and use best practices for QA metrics.
Track defect status (open / closed) during a testing effort to determine ‘readiness’ to go live.
Understand and measure test case coverage for a system – including regression tests.
Understand and document the business processes related to supported systems:
Work closely with users, developers, systems and business analysts to understand the business processes related to supported systems to enable more effective communication and improved test cases. Understanding business process flows is critical to test case planning and creation as it allows for better understanding of user issues and problems – which should result in more creative and efficient test cases.
Test your understanding of requirements by asking the BA questions with regard to story description and acceptance criteria to ensure test cases are accurate depictions of real use cases. Repeat the same exercise with the Design team regarding solution design – flag up to BA and Dev teams if there is a discrepancy between requirement and design.
Requirement and Design Review, Problem Solving and Troubleshooting:
Work in one on one and team settings to improve the overall skill set of the QA team.
Manual testing of business-critical applications in support of business requirements by performing user interface testing and data validation.
Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to create test plans, testable data and content.
Assist with the resolution of data and application issues. Perform application and data support tasks as requested by business users.
Work within a defined SDLC, following software testing standards and sharing best practices.
Understand business needs and provide system options/process recommendations to support the request.
Enjoy problem solving and the challenge of finding system issues
Work with internal resources to develop Test Plans that accurately define the scope of the testing effort, and then create individual test cases that define each test scenario. Once the Test Plan is approved, execute tests, track and communicate the results.
Troubleshoot issues reported by users and work with necessary parties to identify/implement a resolution.
Communicate to users when system changes are implemented and provide support and training.
Independently manage assigned tasks to meet targeted implementation dates
Work in a team environment (experience working in an Agile Scrum Team environment preferred).
Experience, Qualifications, Technical Requirements, Education Required/Preferred
Should have a two-year college degree or equivalent experience.
Required
3-5 Years Related Job Experience
Required
Possess strong organizational, team and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Required
Proficient with various Test Automation Technologies
Required
Experience with Agile methodologies
Required
Four-year college degree.
Preferred

Title: Sr. UI Engineer - Ecommerce (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role:
We’re looking for a Senior UI Engineer to join a brand-new team and initiative at CrowdStrike to focus on eCommerce. We’ll be covering areas like the CrowdStrike App Marketplace and monetization (in-app purchasing/micro-transactions/etc), creative new ways to approach Licensing, Billing and Entitlement across the entire product portfolio, and all the backend analytics work to drive a better user experience and optimize engagement, conversion, cross-sell and up-sell. We’ll also be spearheading the creation of new CrowdStrike offerings that are built on the existing world-class Falcon platform but target a completely E-commerce driven, low-touch, high engagement product experience.
If you’re passionate about building intuitive UI that customers will rave about, tell their friends about and can’t wait to use daily, we want you on our team.
Our stack is Ember, but if you’ve used frameworks like React or Angular you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers we can push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term “big data”. In close collaboration with analysts & clients you’ll get to see the apps & visualizations you’re building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.
What You’ll Need…
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
Familiarity with commerce or E-commerce workflows, paradigms and design to facilitate customer conversion, cross-sell, up-sell and frictionless transactions
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, AngularJS, Backbone or React/Flux.
Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI etc
Comfortable with Git/version control workflows.
A relentless pursuit of simple, intuitive user experience and design
Bonus Points Awarded For…
Experience creating or contributing to open source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with coaxing that last frame-per-second out of browsers.
Prior experience in the cybersecurity or intelligence fields

Description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

About Business UnitIBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Your Life @ IBMAre you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.

Title: Performance Test SME

Engineer, execute, troubleshoot, monitor, automate and report results of test scenarios for scalability tests (performance, load, stress, and duration/endurance/reliability).

Identify system bottlenecks.

Interface with QA Manager, Project Managers, Product Owners and Software teams
Apply QA engineering principals throughout the Agile product lifecycle.
Other related duties as assigned.

Experience Requirement: Minimum three (3) years of related experience.
Other Requirement(s): This position requires U.S. Citizenship or a Green Card holder and the ability to obtain and maintain a Government public trust level security clearance. For a candidate that is a Green Card holder, they must have lived in the United States for at least three out of the past five years prior to your application date. You will also meet the residency qualifications if you lived abroad while on government or military duty or if you were a dependent of a federal employee of military member.

4+ years of scalability, performance, load, and reliability test engineering experience in a distributed system microservices environment.
3+ years of JMeter scripting experience.
Strong persuasion, facilitation and influencing skills.
Strong analytical, organizational and communication skills
Independent self-starter capable of establishing priorities, managing time, meeting deadlines, and working well within a distributed team.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environment with varying priorities.
Hands-on working knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) core services.
Demonstrated knowledge of testing RESTful APIs using Postman, RESTAssured or similar.
Web / Cloud level testing experience.
Proven data analysis and problem-solving skills.
Strong self-driven collaborator with ability to work in diverse teams as a contributing member.
Hands-on experience with containerization technologies (Docker, K8S/Fargate).
Systems internals and network expertise.

Must be able to remain in stationary position for extended periods of time. Stress can be triggered by multiple demands and deadlines.

Title: IT Manager of Quality Assurance – Technology Services
Description:
About Our Job
Employment Requirement : City Employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by September 30, 2021. All persons offered a position will be required to provide valid proof of vaccination prior to starting employment.
This posting will accept applications until August 29th. Please apply as soon as possible.
About Technology Services
The Technology Services Department (TS) of the City and County of Denver is using state-of-the-art technologies and methodologies to deliver and improve the systems, applications and operations that we deliver to our customers. Technology Services supports the people, agencies and ideas that make the City and County of Denver world class city. The City offers a unique opportunity to work with a diverse business and technology environment on a large scale as we employ over 13,000 people, of which 9,000+ are daily technology consumers in support of a diverse population in excess of 700,000 citizens.
About the Quality Assurance Team
The Quality Assurance (QA) team performs various QA activities (requirements review, risk analysis, test planning/strategies, test case creation, manual test execution, automation scripting, performance testing, and user acceptance test coordination) for various applications and integrations to ensure and validate that user expectations are met and that high quality value added solutions are being delivered.
Diversity in the City
The City and County of Denver is committed to cultivating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion. This commitment is woven into our values and belief that we are strongest when we embrace and celebrate our differences. We aim to have employees who are as diverse as our residents, with different perspectives and unique ways of thinking. If you share these values and our enthusiasm for equity, we encourage you to apply to join our team.
As the IT Manager of Quality Assurance, you will be in a key leadership role that will manage and collaborate with a growing team of experienced, multi-faceted, and fun Quality Assurance Analysts that provide a range of services to both our internal and external customers. The QA team members are primarily involved on larger-scale platforms such as Accela, Salesforce, and ServiceNow, but also perform various QA activities for smaller scale projects and on-going enhancements requested through various product channels.
As the QA Manager, you will:
Cultivate team members’ growth through feedback, coaching, and continuous learning (training)
Drive a quality-first approach to software development and delivery by championing quality throughout the organization
Provide team oversight on multiple concurrent projects while effectively identifying opportunities for improvement and solving problems that cross products and programs
Develop creative testing and automation strategies for achieving high quality on complex assignments
Develop and socialize organizational level Quality Assurance standards and documentation
Gather and communicate qualitative and quantitative metrics to stakeholders
Identify and communicate risks to quality to stakeholders as appropriate
Build strong rapport with peers, cross-functional team members, and customers
About You
We are looking for someone with some or all the following skills and experience:
At least 5 years as a Quality Assurance professional, with expertise in manual and automated test planning and execution
Unwavering passion for Quality Assurance, first-class user experiences, and technical integrity
Strong planning, organizational, and time management skills
Experience with Microsoft PowerBI (data visualization and reporting), Azure DevOps (test management, defect management, reporting, requirements management, and project management), and/or ServiceNow (change management, project management, and resource management)
Strong knowledge of software automation and performance testing best practices
Experience with at least one test automation framework and familiarity with one automate scripting language
Working knowledge of automation, API, and performance testing tools such as Katalon Studio, Selenium, Postman, Apica (Zebra Tester), and Apache Jmeter
Willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies
We realize your time is valuable so please do not apply if you do not have at least the following required minimum qualifications:
Education requirement: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or a related field.
Experience Requirement: Three (3) years of professional level information technology work.
Education/Experience Equivalency: Two (2) years of the appropriate type and level of experience may be substituted for each required year of post-high school education.
Additional appropriate education may be substituted for the minimum experience
About Everything Else

Based on education and experience

Title: Software Engineer, Cloud
Description:
Company Description

Full Circle Insights is focused on providing awesome products that give marketers full insights into how their marketing dollars influence their top line revenue results. By doing so, they can make informed, strategic decisions that will increase their ROI. Our customers love us, which is why we consistently see a >90% renewal. By joining our world-class team of experts you will be directly responsible for maintaining the quality of our product releases, as well as our customer projects.
Engineering at Full Circle Insights is all about building a great team and great products in an environment based on trust, openness, collaboration, respect, quality, and work/life balance. We work hard together to deliver high quality products that help our customers succeed. Our team is made up of seasoned software developers, architects, testers, and managers with deep and wide experience, as well as junior and mid-level folks. With the right balance of skills and experience, solid engineering processes, and an attitude of collaboration, our team will continue to push the limits of the Salesforce platform to deliver high quality, innovative products.
Our headquarters are located in San Mateo, CA but we are also open to remote work outside of the San Francisco Bay Area.

Job Description

Our team is looking for a driven, experienced software engineer who can develop and improve our products built on AWS. We are working on ideas at the bleeding edge of marketing analytics. Engineers at Full Circle Insights don’t just write code, they take the initiative to own the development process from design to deployment, gaining a broad range of skills and experience in the process. As part of our team, you’ll even have the opportunity to interact with real-life customers using the products you built and see first-hand why they matter.
Responsibilities include:
Work with CTO, QA engineers, other developers, and product development team to design, develop, test, and maintain Full Circle Insights products
Work with Product Management team to help understand and define requirements
Create and maintain back-end infrastructure for our product(s) on AWS
Ensure scalability of our AWS microservices. Our current stack: .NET/C#, MySQL/RDS, Lambda, API Gateway, SQS, CloudFront, DynamoDB, Javascript (browser-based) - but we are constantly looking for additional microservices to improve our infrastructure
Build upon our infrastructure-as-code process and further automate the deployment and configuration of resources on AWS
Monitor AWS CloudWatch metrics for reliability/scalability issues and investigate alarms
Develop additional Lambda functions in the .NET framework (C#) to support our products
Maintain and expand our APIs
Improve and develop our web-based scripts
Understand and master the Full Circle development process which includes:
Requirements analysis
Software design
Coding and unit tests
Issue tracking
Source control
Peer code review
Release management
Environment management
Technical documentation
Daily stand-up meetings
Working remotely
Work with Customer Success team to troubleshoot and fix customer issues and support customer deployments
Respect in the Workplace: You demonstrate integrity and authenticity, you encourage and facilitate the exchange of ideas, and you foster an inclusive work environment
Connection and Collaboration: You communicate and relate effectively, you promote and encourage teamwork, you manage relationships and expectations, and you think and solve problems creatively
The Ability to Make a Difference: You take personal accountability for action and results, you are action-oriented rather than reactive, and you take initiative and go beyond what is required

Qualifications
3+ years of professional software development experience in C# or Java
3+ years of experience building and maintaining AWS infrastructure
Knowledge of AWS scalability concerns
Prior experience using source control and issue tracking system is required
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience
Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Prior experience developing an infrastructure-as-code process
Prior experience querying and designing MySQL databases
Prior experience working with CI/CD tools like Jenkins
Prior experience working with the Microsoft .NET framework is a plus
Prior experience working in an Agile development environment would be nice
Familiarity with Salesforce.com development is a plus
Prior experience with QA automation tools (Selenium, Cinnamon, and others) is a plus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Proof of eligibility of employment to work in the United States will be required upon hire.
Job Position id: Full Circle Insights is focused on providing awesome products that give marketers full insights into how their marketing dollars influence their top line revenue results. By doing so, they can make informed, strategic decisions that will increase their ROI. Our customers love us, which is why we consistently see a >90% renewal. By joining our world-class team of experts you will be directly responsible for maintaining the quality of our product releases, as well as our customer projects.

Title: Sr. UI Engineer (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role
We’re building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we’re responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.
Our stack is Ember, but if you’ve used frameworks like React or Angular you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers we can push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term “big data”. In close collaboration with analysts & clients you’ll get to see the apps & visualizations you’re building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.
Our ideal candidates are sensitive to the needs of the users of their software & love learning more about their tools every day. Get excited about new features in Chrome Devtools? Tested your work in screen readers? Ever lost half an hour getting an animation’s bezier curve to be just the right kind of bouncy? Looking for a challenge that’s out of the ordinary? Get in touch.
The candidate will join our IT & Security Operations team to work on Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM).
CSPM is a new and complementary product area for CrowdStrike. We’re extending CrowdStrike’s mission of “stopping breaches” into the public cloud control plane and native cloud resources. CrowdStrike’s CSPM offering will give customers visibility into both the (mis)configuration and compliance of native cloud resources, and potential adversary activity involving those resources. When coupled with Falcon, CrowdStrike’s endpoint security offering, our CSPM offering will provide a more comprehensive perspective on how the adversary is targeting key customer infrastructure.
What You’ll Need
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, AngularJS, Backbone or React/Flux.
Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI etc
Comfortable with Git/version control workflows.
Bonus Points Awarded For:
Experience creating or contributing to open source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with coaxing that last frame-per-second out of browsers.
#LI-AR1
#LI-OC
#LI-Remote
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation policy
Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
Paid parental leave, including adoption
Flexible work environment
Wellness programs
Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats
We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

Title: Sr. Software Developer
Description:
Location: Remote
SUMMARY:
The Senior Software Developer will be responsible for translating high level business requirements into fully functional code. Manage requirements and scope to ensure delivery of functionality in time for DHL eCommerce Solutions with high quality.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide technical subject matter expertise to software development teams responsible for systems designs.

7 to 8 years of experience in a directly related field.
REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS:

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description:
All About Us:
At TransLoc, we believe that public transit is central to the future of mobility. Made up of the three most-trusted companies in transit technology (TransLoc, Ride Systems and DoubleMap), today's TransLoc delivers a one-stop-shop for transit providers seeking transit orchestration solutions. Recognized by Fast Company for our innovative technology, our intelligent transportation software portfolio includes flexible demand response, fixed route systems, and planning services, providing software and services for more than 1500 transit providers worldwide. Our fixed route and on-demand systems have powered more than 600 million annual rides, helping transit users reach jobs, schools, healthcare and other important destinations in an equitable and accessible way. If being part of an organization bridging the chasm between today’s needs and tomorrow’s demands is important to you, we want to hear from you today!
Why you should join us:
At TransLoc, we constantly strive to create an atmosphere that allows our employees (TransLocians) to do their best work. We are committed to keeping TransLocians happy, healthy, motivated, focused and creative. We’ve designed our top-notch benefits program with these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we’ve built a place where we truly love working, and we think you’ll love it too! We have offices in Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina, Indianapolis, Indiana and Morgan, Utah. The rest of our TransLocians work remotely across the US. Our current registered states where we can hire remotely are Arizona, Texas, Michigan and Pennsylvania.
Our Values:
People First - Rise Up - Play To Win - Do The Right Thing - Pursuit of Knowledge
Requirements
We're looking for a QA Automation Engineer who understands how, when and what to automate so that your team consistently ships superior quality software that performs even better than users expect. You'll help your cross-functional team write robust, well-defined stories and deliver high-quality code using tools like Cypress, Selenium, and POSTman to ensure a reliable regression suite and extend and improve upon our existing automation framework. You'll utilize software engineering best practices like code reviews, refactoring, and iterative development to ensure that our automation reflects best practices, and you'll champion a quality mindset as a member of a cross-functional, agile team to ensure that every step of our process contributes to building the best possible product.
You should have...
Achieved a bachelor's degree in a science or technology related field or relevant experience
2+ years of quality assurance automation experience
Experience in quality assurance automation using tools such as Cypress, Selenium, POSTman, etc.
Mobile experience and SaaS experience is a plus
Experience working as a member of a cross functional team practicing Scrum/Agile
Programming experience with languages like JavaScript, Python, Ruby
Experience working with suites of automated tests
Benefits
TransLoc cares about its employees as much as we care about equitable and accessible mobility. We work hard, play hard (hello unlimited time off), and want our employees to know they are valued. That’s why we offer competitive compensation packages, generous benefits, including dental, vision, 100% employer-paid medical coverage for employees as well as generous contributions towards spousal and dependent coverage, and Pick Your Perk a $2,400/yr stipend to be used any way you’d like (seriously, ANY way you’d like!). In the market for a new vehicle? Take advantage of our Ford discount program! TransLoc also offers a strong 401k retirement matching plan, and a progressive work environment.
Currently this role is 100% remote due to the pandemic. However, under normal circumstances the position will be based out of our Indianapolis office and will play a critical role in shaping and growing TransLoc.
TransLoc is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and invite applications from people of all walks of life. TransLoc is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to EEO for all employees and to providing our people with a harassment and discrimination free environment. All decisions at TransLoc, are based on business need, individual qualifications, and job requirements without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there is any way we can make the interview process better for you; we’re happy to accommodate!
Recruiting Agencies, Please Note:
TransLoc will not accept unsolicited assistance from recruiting/search agencies for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by recruiting or search agencies to any employee at TransLoc via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search/recruitment agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of TransLoc. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by TransLoc as a result of the referral or through other means.

Title: Senior Test Engineer
Description:
Job description
Our Client located in the SW Suburbs of Minneapolis is looking to hire a Senior Software Test Engineer. Position is a full time direct hire opportunity with an Industry Leader in Electronics. For immediate consideration/information go ahead and apply online.

· Provide periodic regression and performance testing while contributing to an ever-growing regression suite of automated tests
