Title: QA Automation and Performance IT Team Manager
Description:
Req ID: 61834
Job Location: Tulsa Tulsa OK
Areas of Interest: Digital Technology; Information Services
BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .
Bonus Type
Discretionary
Summary
At BOK Financial, our success starts with our incredible talent. We are searching for an IT Team Manager to lead one of our high caliber teams. This is an opportunity to become involved in some major transformative projects and quickly make an impact. Bring your passion for team building, technical support, and development. It’s an exciting time to join us!
About the Role
The QA Automation and Performance IT Team Manager in our Quality Assurance group is a key role managing, maturing and providing
strategic leadership in our Test Automation and Performance Testing areas. This role offers an opportunity to grow your skills in areas of quality assurance, leadership, technology and team-building. You should have a high level of experience with implementing and delivering quality software with modern Test Automation and Performance testing practices.
Our Test Automation uses Selenium and Appium frameworks with LoadRunner as the Performance Testing tool. This is a player/coach opportunity with both IT Team Manager and with individual contributor roles.

What You Can Expect
You will lead the organization within the five pillars of IT: 1) Strategy, 2) Project Execution, 3) Financial Planning, 4) Process Improvement and Governance, and 5) Talent. Your goals and objectives will tie back directly to these pillars. You will be part of an exciting and ongoing digital transformation within BOK Financial with a long-term focus.

You will build and lead a team of direct reports (both employee and contractors) to support the needs of BOKF. You will partner with vendors, QA resources, project managers, software development and other IT partners. We are early in our test automation maturity so you will drive how to mature and expand it across BOKF.
Team Culture
Our team is committed to delivering the best IT solutions for our lines of business. We collaborate with other IT members, as well as our business partners. It is a fast-paced, ever-changing yet fun environment with several new exciting initiatives.

The mission of IT is to "Enable Business Success and Create Raving Fans." We do this through our shared quest to continuously improve while simultaneously optimizing our applications and processes. We are a determined, smart, and collaborative group eager to welcome you to the team.
How You'll Spend Your Time
You will oversee the ongoing execution, governance and maturity of the automation and performance testing areas.
You will facilitate the reporting of your portfolio for executive and stakeholder audiences using scorecards, metrics, and measures to demonstrate progress and promote alignment.
You will partner with leadership and project teams to understand their needs and provide guidance on how automation or performance testing can be achieved on their applications.
You will lead in the development of the test strategies, develop and execute scripts and then document the results to discuss with the project team.
You will manage work assignments and utilize our vendor partners (onshore and offshore) when outside assistance is needed to supplement staff.
You will work closely with your project teams to make sure any roadblocks are resolved.
You will facilitate meetings when necessary and be comfortable addressing an audience that might include some executives.
You will recruit, motivate, develop, and retain the very best technical talent.
You collaborate with IT Leadership during budget and/or project planning to ensure staffing levels are accurately represented.
We'd Like to Talk to You
TEAM BUILDER: Your ability to listen, collaborate, respond, coach, and provide constructive feedback will set your team up for success.
COMMUNICATION: You'll need exceptional verbal and written communication to express yourself clearly and concisely to internal clients, including C-level audiences.
ORGANIZATION: You will need to be efficient to handle multiple requests and prioritize your work.
TECHNICAL SKILLS: Because you are the Manager, it is vital to be tech-savvy. You will need to understand the systems you support, integrations, and how it affects all sides.
RELATIONSHIP BUILDER: You must be able to relate to any audience and build trust by leveraging strong interpersonal skills and a high level of integrity.
RESULTS ORIENTED: You show initiative as you focus on the desired deliverables while meeting and exceeding your goals.
PROBLEM SOLVER: You are able to track and solve complex problems in a variety of situations and function effectively in rapidly changing or uncertain conditions.

Education & Experience Requirements
This level of knowledge is normally acquired through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Information Management, or a related field and 7-10 years of directly related professional experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.
BOK Financial is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees. With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career!

Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!

BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for training, compensation, transfer, promotion and other aspects of employment for all qualified applicants and employees without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, genetic information or veteran status.
Please contact recruiting_coordinators@bokf.com with any questions.

Title: Digital Engineer I- QA Engineer
Description:
In this role, the candidate will be a critical member of the team building the foundation for Best Buy's next generation web platform. They will conduct story acceptance testing and develop test automation suites for new and existing applications. They will be expected to evaluate and refactor in a rapid manner for every part of our infrastructure. Overall knowledge of testing applications to run on a scalable platform is expected. They will be working in an agile environment which values test-driven development. We leverage a DevOps model, with our development teams engaged in monitoring, optimizing and supporting our production environments. We have many initiatives running in parallel including cloud technologies, infrastructure automation, and REST based microservices and user interfaces.
Best Buy Digital and Technology Multichannel Ordering is responsible for the order management experience on BestBuy.com – this includes delivery and fulfillment notifications and order modifications. We have a microservices architecture and integrate with Inventory, Fulfillment, Tax, 3rd-party payment, Incentives, Customer Data, and Order Management. Our team provides both the front-end user experience and back-end scalable REST services.
Responsibilities:
Develop test automation suites for REST APIs and microservices
Develop test automation suites for event-based systems (Kafka, JMS, MQ)
Develop test automation suites for user interfaces (React, Node.js)
Working in an agile environment including epic and story acceptance testing

Minimum Requirements:
4+ years related experience; additional 2 years’ experience without BS/BA
3+ years of experience backend Test Automation
3+ years of experience Cross-browser Website Testing (HTML, JavaScript)
3+ years of experience Java / Groovy
2+ years of experience Microservices Architecture
2+ years of experience REST
Preferred Requirements:
Selenium
Spock
Postman
Cassandra
Kafka, JMS
TDD / SDET / Refactoring
Continuous Delivery (Jenkins, Docker, Gradle)
Git, JIRA
Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)

Title: QA Automation Engineer
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
A Financial Services client in the Austin, TX area is looking to add a QA to the team! This client has traditionally outsourced this piece of the business to offshore resources, but they are bringing this team on-shore to the Austin office. The office is in the process of returning on-site, so it is expected that you can relocated to the Austin area by January 2022 at the latest. **To be able to go on-site, this client requires employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, and to provide documentation proving that you've been fully vaccinated.**
This role is all web-based application testing, no mobile testing, and 100% automated-focused. You will be working on some responsive sites, but the available menus are limited. You should also be prepared to handle some load testing & functional testing. The team operates in an Agile environment, following 3 week sprint cycles, and you will participate in daily stand-ups.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
1-3 years of development exp, plus 1-3 years of QA experience
o Heavy automated testing exp
Selenium exp
JS programming exp – C# also ok
Exp integrating test scripts into CI/CD pipeline

DESIRED SKILLS
Robot Framework exp (Python-based)

Title: Sr. UI Engineer - Ecommerce (Remote)
Description:
At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.
About the Role:
We’re looking for a Senior UI Engineer to join a brand-new team and initiative at CrowdStrike to focus on eCommerce. We’ll be covering areas like the CrowdStrike App Marketplace and monetization (in-app purchasing/micro-transactions/etc), creative new ways to approach Licensing, Billing and Entitlement across the entire product portfolio, and all the backend analytics work to drive a better user experience and optimize engagement, conversion, cross-sell and up-sell. We’ll also be spearheading the creation of new CrowdStrike offerings that are built on the existing world-class Falcon platform but target a completely E-commerce driven, low-touch, high engagement product experience.
If you’re passionate about building intuitive UI that customers will rave about, tell their friends about and can’t wait to use daily, we want you on our team.
Our stack is Ember, but if you’ve used frameworks like React or Angular you’re the kind of person we’re looking for and we’ll help get you up to speed. As we support only evergreen browsers we can push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web as a platform, on top of a system that strips any hyperbole from the term “big data”. In close collaboration with analysts & clients you’ll get to see the apps & visualizations you’re building used every day to hunt for hackers and protect systems.
What You’ll Need…
A desire to collaborate closely with users, designers, & testers to deliver quality software that solves problems.
Familiarity with commerce or E-commerce workflows, paradigms and design to facilitate customer conversion, cross-sell, up-sell and frictionless transactions
A deep understanding of Javascript and considerable experience building thick-client applications with modern frameworks such as Ember, AngularJS, Backbone or React/Flux.
Experience with testing frameworks, tools and methodologies such as QUnit, Mocha & Selenium.
Functional knowledge & interest in developing genuinely accessible interfaces.
Strong HTML & CSS skills, with bonus points for experience with animation, knowledge of approaches to scalable/modular CSS, & preprocessors such as SCSS & LESS.
Familiarity with client-side build processes & tools - Grunt, Gulp, Ember CLI etc
Comfortable with Git/version control workflows.
A relentless pursuit of simple, intuitive user experience and design
Bonus Points Awarded For…
Experience creating or contributing to open source projects.
Experience with graphics & visualization tools such as D3 or ThreeJS.
Interest & experience with design & data visualization.
Experience with coaxing that last frame-per-second out of browsers.
Prior experience in the cybersecurity or intelligence fields

Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation policy
Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan
Paid parental leave, including adoption

Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats
We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

The Senior Software Developer will be responsible for translating high level business requirements into fully functional code. Manage requirements and scope to ensure delivery of functionality in time for DHL eCommerce Solutions with high quality.

Perform other related duties as required.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
7 to 8 years of experience in a directly related field.
REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS:
Required Technology Skills
Expert in Cloud-Native Development, proficient in JDK 11, Spring Boot 2.x, Spring Cloud, Spring Batch and Integration using Microservice architecture
Well versed with OOPS design concepts and good grasp of architectural patterns
Hands-on experience with unit testing/integration testing tools like Mockito, RestAssured, Cucumber.
Familiarity with event driven architecture patterns.
Git/Maven expertise.
Working experience in building Images and Containerization using Docker, Docker Engine using an orchestration system like Kubernetes/Openshift
Expert in designing and developing RESTful APIs, schemas, documentation using tools like Swagger and dev testing using tools like Postman

Microservices caching patterns
Experience analysing/tuning microservices performance
Ability to align workday with US Eastern Time Zone.
Nice To Have Technology Skills

Master level knowledge of SQL language, triggers, views, stored procedures and complex SQLs under Oracle or other RDBMS systems.
Experience building and deploying projects using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins

Experience in designing, building and running load tests using applications such as Locust or JMeter
Building and managing support and monitoring dashboards for high-volume APIs using tools such as ELK or Splunk stack
Experience in Angular and/or React would be a plus.

API Integration Layer experience.
Other Skills
Experience with Agile Software Development practices using tools like JIRA/Confluence.
Proven expertise troubleshooting and solution design for complex issues.
Apply critical thinking skills, experience, and research sources in the design and implementation of technical solutions which improve usability, analyse maintainability, and scalability.
Ensure best practice use of applications by keeping abreast with emerging technologies to ensure optimal performance of the applications.
Strong emphasis on code quality, peer reviews, and writing test-driven code
Ability to create technical specifications, architecture diagrams, network diagrams, data models, object diagrams, process flows and application development artifacts
Experience developing on a full project life cycle, from requirements to delivery
Excellent Planning & Organizational skills
Excellent communication, documentation skills plus team leadership skills.
Ability to research new technologies and create conceptual models or solutions and present them to high-level audience across business, application and technology domains.
Proven experience with TDD, and ability to mentor others in effective TDD

Physical demands are consistent with a professional office setting.
Regular sitting at work station for 25 – 75% of the work shift.
Ability to work alternate shifts (< 20%).

Excellent communication and documentation skills

Title: Senior Test Engineer
Description:
Basic Information
Name: Senior Test Engineer
Job ID: 1348
Posting Locations: King of Prussia, PA
Job Type: full-time
Status: Regular
Category: Individual Contributor
Description and Requirements
JOB SUMMARY:


This position is responsible for providing professional expertise in test scripting in manual and automated test frameworks, test execution and reporting, allowing for continuous improvement in test efficiency, test cycle times, and completeness of testing coverage.



ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Development of the manual test scripts

Set up and execution of the manual or automated test scripts

Logging & recording of the test outcomes/results

Daily reporting of the progress/status of the test execution

Analysis and recovery from the execution errors

Assist with the maintenance of the test scripts library

Reporting of the bugs

Providing redlines of test cases to Test Analysts

Analyze requirements / user stories and define test coverage and scope for manual and automation testing

Create test automation scripts as well as design, develop and execute test suite/s for one or more products

Strategize, plan and estimate the assigned work as well as provide periodic status reports on project milestones

Troubleshooting technical issues to identify root cause and corrective improvements

Support the team in all testing efforts.

Occasional travel required

Participate in other projects or duties.



SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:


N/A



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:


Working knowledge with a one or more databases like SQL, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, Flat File, MongoDB

Excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities, and proven design skills

Ability to drive higher quality by assessing end-user impact of issues and thereby being a quality advocate

Working knowledge with a one or more databases like SQL, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, Flat File, MongoDB

Ability to listen and understand information and communicate the same.

Must possess good organizational skills.

Must be results oriented, customer focused, and exhibit good interpersonal skills.

Proficiency in Microsoft office packages.

Sufficient knowledge of business communications, including telephone, voicemail, and e-mail and operations of office machines, such as photocopier, scanner, and fax.



EDUCATION AND TRAINING:


Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline or equivalent experience

Ten (10) plus years of experience in application software environments or related experience

Experience with test automation tools like Selenium, HP-UFT etc.

Experience with various software development methodologies as well as with tools like JIRA or HP-ALM

Experience with testing in virtual and cloud environments

Experience with one or more load and performance testing tools like JMeter, NeoLoad etc.

Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience



Other Qualifications
The Winning Way behaviors that all Vertex employees need in order to meet the expectations of each other, our customers, and our partners.


Communicate with Clarity - Be clear, concise and actionable. Be relentlessly constructive. Seek and provide meaningful feedback.
Act with Urgency - Adopt an agile mentality - frequent iterations, improved speed, resilience. 80/20 rule – better is the enemy of done. Don’t spend hours when minutes are enough.
Work with Purpose - Exhibit a “We Can” mindset. Results outweigh effort. Everyone understands how their role contributes. Set aside personal objectives for team results.
Drive to Decision - Cut the swirl with defined deadlines and decision points. Be clear on individual accountability and decision authority. Guided by a commitment to and accountability for customer outcomes.
Own the Outcome - Defined milestones, commitments and intended results. Assess your work in context, if you’re unsure, ask. Demonstrate unwavering support for decisions.

Title: Senior Test Engineer
Description:
Senior Test Engineer
Job Location: Syracuse
Company Overview:
Our Power Systems designs and manufactures gallium nitride (GaN) power transistors for the $4.8B high-voltage (1200 V) power transistor market. GaN makes transistors that are 10 times faster than silicon (Si) power devices enabling economically significant improvements in sophisticated power systems in their physical size, cost and efficiency. GaN offers a quantum leap over Si in power management performance and has significant cost, performance and reliability advantages. Applications for GaN transistors include server power supplies for Data Centers, Motor Drives, Electric Cars and Solar Inverters.
Our Power Systems is headquartered in Santa Clara, California. It builds the GaN power devices in a state-of-the-art fabrication facility located in Syracuse, New York.
Job Description:
This is a key position in our Syracuse facility to support wafer sort operation. You will be responsible for hardware/software development and test operation to ensure NPI products are fully supported.
Job Responsibilities
· Develop probe card and other necessary hardware to support engineering and production on wafer sort.
· Develop test program and work cross-functionally to ensure all requirements are met.
· Characterize our FinFET device using ATE and other test equipment.
· Analyze post sort data and provide meaningful result and solution. Provide pareto chart and show defect pattern.
· Basic prober operation and maintenance.
· Make minor modification on bench for quick turn-around engineering projects.
· Communicate and develop test strategy cross-functionally to ensure seamless gap on test.
· Off-hour meetings with our Santa Clara and Philippines teams will be required.
Qualifications
· Minimum of 2~7 years of Test Engineering experience. Product Engineering experience a plus.
· Experience with high volume production.
· Knowledge in CMOS basics and device physics. GaN experience a plus.
· Experience with high power testing on component or system level.
· Extensive experience with bench and tester setup for device characterization, qual and failure analysis.
· Yield analysis (JMP/Minitab) with the ability to identify outliers and provide screening solution.
· Familiar with ATE and probe card development and work with suppliers to support NPI and production.
· Familiar with ATE, handler and wafer sort operation. Analog tester experience such as Eagles, Focus and Chroma a plus.
· Clear written and verbal communication skills are required.
· Self-driven individual with project management skill required.
· BSEE required, MSEE preferred.

Title: Quality Assurance Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Quality Assurance Engineers are responsible for monitoring all stages of software development, validate the conformity of the deliverables, and coordinate with the customers and business partners during the user acceptance testing. They are also responsible for automating the execution of the tests in the context of increasing delivery speed and building of automated regression test suites in an agile development environment. Validate test results utilizing testing tools/utilities and provide timely test result feedback to the project team. Provide first level support and configuration of the testing tools and testing environment. Collaborate with project team members to improve overall product/solution quality.
While maintaining an in-depth understanding of at least a couple of quality assurance tools and methodologies, it is expected that this role will have a broad knowledge of the information technology field, including but not limited to software development, performance, and security.
Quality Assurance: Involved with all facets of quality assurance and testing.
Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback.
Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
Design, develop and execute automation scripts.
Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track issues.
Perform thorough regression testing when issues are resolved, or functionalities changed.
Investigate the causes of non-conforming software.
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect counts.
Support user acceptance testing activities.
Identify and communicate when QA processes are not being adhered to or when insufficient quality conditions exist
Collaborate with project teams to develop and promote quality assurance practices to improve overall data quality.
Champion new processes, software and/or systems to improve the organization's data integrity and data governance effectiveness.
Thoroughly test all BI platform component changes to ensure that the business requirements have been satisfied before approving the promotion of the changes to the production environment.
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools, strategies, and methodologies.
Data Integrity Testing:
Display a test to break attitude and a drive to 100% test coverage.
Demonstrate the ability to take the point of view of the customer.
Possess a strong desire for quality and attention to detail.
Create test scripts and test plans to enable streamlined BI solution testing practices.
Mentor project team members on creating test scenarios and proper testing procedures.
Prioritize testing based on relative risk to the system. Analyze, recommend, implement, configure and administer automated testing tools targeted to enhance data integrity and quality assurance practices.
Create testing strategies for manual and automated testing.
Provide training and support in the use of testing automation products and strategies.
Understand and test data integration and data transformation processes.
Understand data needs and define strategies to manage data in support of effective testing.
Project Planning:
Comfortable with bottom-up planning
Help to define user acceptance criteria
Provide high level and detailed estimates
Decompose work into stories and tasks
Prioritize work
Customer Service:
Take the necessary steps to ensure our customer’s needs are met to the maximum extent possible in an accurate and timely manner.
Communicate with technical and non-technical team members, leaders, and customers.
Maintain a close and strong working relationship with project team members and leadership
Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science, system analysis or related field, or a combination of education and work experience that provides the necessary skills to perform the essential job functions.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in the software quality field including prior hands-on quality engineering experience.
Demonstrated experience developing and executing test cases, scripts, plans and procedures to support various development methodologies.
Familiarity with entire software development life cycle and test cycles (Unit, Regression, Functional, Systems, Stress, Performance and Smoke/Sanity).
Understanding of existing QA best practices and methodologies to design, implement and automate processes.
Working knowledge of data testing best practices including data profiling and modeling in relational, dimensional and data warehousing scenarios.
Prior success using a metrics-driven approach and closed-loop feedback to improve software and solution deliverables and improve predictability and reliability of releases.
Highly organized, detail-oriented, extremely responsive and able to prioritize a large number of tasks.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills are required, including the ability to communicate clearly and professionally, both verbally and in writing.
Must be able to work independently and collaboratively with minimum supervision. Requires exceptional organizational skills, problem-solving skills, and flexibility in changing priorities.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, and demonstrate team building attitude and skills. Analyze, evaluate, and develop solutions to complex problems; make a positive personal impact on others; be innovative and creative, and be logical and objective. Train, instruct, and guide others as directed. Interact positively with representatives of other associations, vendors, and commercial entities.
Desired:
In-depth knowledge of advanced testing techniques and technologies
Knowledge of testing tools and platforms as Informatica, Datameer, DbFit, Unified Functional Testing, Selenium, and Test Complete.
Proficient with SQL programming practices in Oracle and MS SQL Server environments using modern/common query tools.
Understanding of multi-tier web application architecture, data warehouse, and other BI-related architectures and deployments.
Demonstrated knowledge of PowerShell scripting, Java or C#, Cognos and Informatica.
Familiarity with tools and platforms such as Confluence, Jira, GIT, Jenkins, and Ansible.
Experience working in an Agile environment.
Closing Statement

Salary Grade: S4
Minimum: $79,830
Midpoint: $99,788

Where the Light Starts
What does it mean to be the source of light? On a basic level, it means operating from a place of honesty and integrity. It’s how we achieve things. How we provide affordable, reliable, environmentally sensitive energy. Because it matters. We’ve pledged to serve, honor, and care for this community. That means the 13 counties we service, and it means one another. It means the people right here at OPPD—proudly comprised and welcoming of every creed, race, age, orientation, and color. Being “where the light starts” means showing up for each other and the people we serve. Doing the right thing even when no one’s watching. We’re proud of our commitment. We reward creative problem solving. We recognize that consistency and reliability are tremendous resources. That providing these things to the community and each other is a privilege. Because we are leading the way the future is powered. We are the source of light. Out there. In here. Everywhere.

EOE: Protected Veterans/Disability
How To Apply

Apply online at www.oppd.com on or before September 7, 2021
Recruiter: Laura Fritson - lmfritson@oppd.com

Title: Front End Web Developer
Description:
Company Description

Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 25 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency’s heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. When combined with its strength in performance creative and media, Merkle creates customer experiences that drive improved marketing results and shareholder value. With more than 4,100 employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland with 16 additional offices in the US and 8 offices in Europe and Asia. In 2016, the agency joined the Dentsu Aegis Network.

Job Description

As a Front End Web Developer, you will build web apps and API-based tools to support implementation of media team initiatives.
Responsibilities
Manage backend and front end of Angular web app
Integrate APIs into web app
Build web-based tools to support productivity of media team
Communicate status, timeline, deliverables, and follow-up items
Qualifications
Requirements:
6+ years of experience within HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, FTP, and CMS programs
Experience with JavaScript Angular framework
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, HCI, or equivalent practical experience
Experience in designing and implementing user interfaces (UIs)
Ability to debug code
In-depth understanding of REST APIs
Ability to use machine learning and NLP libraries
Experience with scripting a language, such as: Python, Ruby, other.
Useful, not required technical skills:
Ability to tune web app performance, improving site latency
Ability to automate routine tasks
Familiar with automated testing tools, such as Selenium, Jenkins, Karate, Cucumber, etc.

Ability to use machine learning and NLP libraries
Experience with scripting a language, such as: Python, Ruby, other.

Ability to automate routine tasks

Title: Full Stack Engineer - $150k (Python, JavaScript)
Description:
Full Stack Engineer - $150k (Python, JavaScript)
Job Title: Federal Sales Director (DHS, DoJ, Tech Sales)
Location Full Stack Engineer - $150k (Python, JavaScript)
Salary: $140k-$160k Base + Benefits and 401k
Requirements: Python, Vue, Integrating APIs

With offices across the world, we offer proprietary drone detection and mitigation products for government and private use. We are proud to offer cutting edge anti-drone technology to protect countries across the world from foreign and domestic terrorism.

We are publicly traded, yet lean, agile, and operate as a fast-paced dynamic start up.

Our technology is utilized by government agencies (DoD, DHS), all branches of the military, state and local law enforcement, prison systems, and a range of private companies.

Due to growth, we are actively hiring a Full Stack Engineer w/ 3+ years of experience using Python and JavaScript (ideally Vue.JS).

This role will lean more towards the back end.

You will be working on our flagship Command Control product which integrates with our clients' products to collect sensor data and display that data visually.

This role will focus on integrating our APIs w/ clients APIs and integrating our products w/ customers products.

You will be our first US SW Engineering hire and work with our 10 person US team. You will communicate as needed with our customers to facilitate integrations and act as the face of our US team. The rest of our Engineering team is located in Australia and they will help support you on all projects.

As such, the right candidate will be excited about a high impact role with a lean team, as well as communicating with customers and taking a lead role.

Experience w/ Ruby, RoR, Go, Docker, Postman, and/or AWS are a HUGE plus but not required.

Many of our employees and accounts have a military and/or law enforcement background, so candidates with similar background are encouraged to apply!

If you have this experience, please apply immediately. We are actively interviewing this week and next for this high profile position.
Top Reasons to Work with Us
Remote: Partial Remote
Compensation: $140k-$160k Base + Benefits and 401k
Technology: Cutting edge technology
Mission Driven: Fight against domestic and international terrorism
Growth: Huge opportunity for personal and professional growth
Culture: Supportive, positive culture
What You Will Be Doing
Develop and deploy software platform for users across the US
Build features and components from conceptualization to realization for back end, middleware, and front end
Collaborate w/ US partners on ignorations for our flagship product and middleware for larger platforms
Collaborate with our SW Engineering team in Australia as needed
Test new and existing features on a spectrum on devices
What You Need for this Position
3+ Years of Experience w/:
Python
JavaScript, Vue.JS
REST/JSON

Nice to Haves:
Go, Ruby, RoR
Go
ROR
Docker, Postman
AWS
What's In It for You
$140k-$160k Base + Benefits and 401k
Remote Options
Vacation/PTO
Medical
Dental
Vision
Bonus
401k

So, if you are a Full Stack Engineer - $150k (Python, JavaScript) with experience, please apply today!
